event_details.name: TCHAD - Afrique Centrale Mouvement de Population : 02/20

results.description:
Le département d’Assoungha dans la province du Ouaddaï a reçu un nombre important des refugiés en provenance de EL Djineina au soudan depuis le 29 Décembre 2019 au total 12044 réfugiés ont été enregistrés à la date du 26 janvier 2020 et la flux est en cours. Ce Mouvement de population est dû  à un conflit intercommunautaire.
Les autorités administratives locales, le HCR, le CNAAR et la CRT ont mené des évaluations et réalisés des actions pour assister les réfugiés se trouvant sur les différents sites et les villages d’accueils.  
Suite à cette situation, la Croix-Rouge du Tchad (CRT) a dépêché une mission d’évaluation du 26 au 29 Janvier 2020  à Adré dans la province du Ouaddaï. 
La grande partie de ces réfugiés est composée des enfants en majorité de moins de 5 ans et de femmes dont la plupart soit allaitantes soit enceintes. La vulnérabilité de ces réfugiés est visible.
Ils sont installés  le long de la frontière Tchad- Soudan d’où le climat varie entre 19 à 22 degré en cette période de fraicheur. C’est ce qui les expose aux intempéries. Pour preuve beaucoup d’enfants ont la toux et aussi l’écoulement nasal.

Les réfugiés sont profondément  touchées et ce déplacement  aggrave considérablement leur vulnérabilité face aux maladies, au froid et surtout compromettent dangereusement leur existence (atteinte à l’intégrité physique, morale, etc).
results.actions_others:
•	Action du HCR : identification des réfugiés (bracelet âge en cours) dans les sites d’Adré, Agang, Ardebé, Hilouta, Wandalou, Tougoultougouli, Yakata, Ablouk, Andabarta, avant de procéder au réenregistrement dans les jours avenir,
Distribution de NFI (bidon, couverture, natte) a Hilouta, et Ardebé avec un protocole local (certains ont reçu de bidon, d’autres des couvertures) selon les besoins des uns et des autres.
Noter que les deux sites comptent respectivement 75 ménages soit 517 individus à Ardebé et 1044 ménages soit 5220 individus à Hilouta.
Le HCR et la CNAAR sont en concertation, pour la délocalisation des différents sites (provisoires) vers un site définitif à Moura une localité située à 45Km D’Abéché (Est).
•	Action PAM : distribution de vivre à Hilouta pour 15 jours à un nombre des ménages,
•	Action IRC : assure le volet santé à travers une clinique mobile et appuie des centres de santé en intrants.
•	Action JRS : effectue une évaluation sur le secteur éducation,
•	Action du Comité départemental de la CRT/Assoungha : accueil premier secours et enregistrement de des refugiés en mobilisant 37 volontaires.
•	Action de l’équipe de la mission : visité les sites de Ardébé, Agang, Hilouta, Wandalou, Tougoultougouli, Ablouk et Ardebé, suite à cette visite l’équipe a fait le constat suivant après échanges avec les réfugiés et observations sur place :
results.other_sources: UNHCR, CNAAR

actions_taken.summary:
Desde el inicio de la emergencia la Sociedad Nacional mantiene estrecho contacto y articulación
con la Federación Internacional de Sociedades. Una visita conjunta del Presidente de la Sociedad
Nacional y del Jefe de Misión para el Cono Sur de la FICR se realizó el pasado 6 de febrero, en
ocasión de que el Gobierno Provincial solicitará el apoyo a la Cruz Roja.

Cruz Roja Argentina ha montado un Centro de Operaciones de Emergencia en la Sede Central,
siguiendo de cerca los casos de desnutrición y evaluando la complejidad de la situación y el
contexto.
Mientras que en la provincia de Salta el día 6 y 7 de febrero del presente año se participó en la
Mesa de Diálogo convocada por el gobernador de la provincia, junto a los distintos Ministerios
provinciales, organizaciones humanitarias y actores involucrados. A raiz de ello, se propuso
avanzar en un convenio de colaboración entre la Cruz Roja y el Gobierno de la Provincia de Salta,
quienes luego ejecutarán el mismo a través de Cruz Roja Argentina y el Ministerio de Salud,
respectivamente.

results.description: El 29 de enero del 2020 la Provincia de Salta declaró, luego del fallecimiento de seis niños por desnutrición, la emergencia socio sanitaria (formalmente por decreto N° 140/2020), para los departamentos de San Martín, Rivadavia y Orán, ubicados al noroeste de dicha provincia. El decreto tendrá vigencia por un periodo de 180 días, plazo renovable, y apunta a cubrir las necesidades de alimentación, salud y agua segura de los pobladores del norte provincial, para lo cual luego de decretado se convocó a una mesa multisectorial que reunió a legisladores nacionales y provinciales, rectores de universidades y funcionarios para afrontar la compleja situación del norte provincial. Se incorporaron recientemente a la mesa importantes organizaciones de la sociedad civil. Particularmente toda la región chaqueña en Argentina ha sufrido este último tiempo el apogeo del déficit de deposiciones pluviales. La incidencia directa sobre la vida de las personas es de alta relevancia, en primer medida con grandes repercusiones sobre la salud de las personas en materia de consumo humano diario, así como afectando a los cultivos y al ganado, y finalmente Hay que reconocer el déficit estructural que presenta esta zona, con bajas infraestructura de reservorios y baja calidad en las fuentes primarias. La sequía, que estaba teniendo una gran repercusión, como causa secundaria en la muerte de niños y niñas de la zona, así como en la salud de toda la población del lugar, actualmente el contexto empero debido a los desbordes de los ríos principales e inundaciones repentinas que se hicieron presente en estos últimos cinco días en la región. Dando lugar a nuevas zonas de afectación por las condiciones de anegamiento. Luego de declarada la emergencia se han agregado dos casos más por fallecimiento.
results.actions_others:
Recientemente se mantuvo una reunión conjunta con los Ministerios de Salud, Desarrollo Social,
Seguridad e Infraestructura, representantes de las Naciones Unidas, Unicef, Organización
Mundial de la Salud y Unión Europea.
La provincia se enceuntra planificando la respuesta a la emergencia en el departamento
Rivadavia, en cuanto a las necesidades urgentes, con una mesa de articulación interministerial
para la crisis, con equipos técnicos en el lugar. En cuanto a acciones de corto plazo y con una
previsión a 7 días, por medio del ejército ha iniciado un proceso de distribución de agua para la
zona de Santa Victoria y comunidades aledañas.
Por otro lado, está en marcha la construcción de cosechas en zonas mas alejadas, a través del
proyecto presentado en el Ente Nacional de Obras Hídricas de Saneamiento (ENOHSA), que tiene
un primer financiamiento del gobierno nacional para avanzar en 100, que representan un 5% de
las necesarias. El Ministerio de infraestructura, también, licitó la excavación de 7 pozos
profundos, para resolver la necesidad en parajes, que cubrirán las poblaciones cercanas.
El Ejército Argentino hace su aporte al plan con maquinas para realizar los pozos y el
conocimiento y experiencia. Actualmente están funcionando 3 pozos:
● 1. Paraje El Rosado (Municipio de Santa Victoria este)
● 2. Alto la Sierra ( Santa Victoria Este)
● 3. Los Blancos (Municipio Rivadavia Banda Norte
Finalmente el estado se encuentra trabajando para la articulación y aplicación del Plan Nacional
Argentina Sin Hambre, por medio de la entrega de módulos alimentarios de emergencia. Por su
parte, el Instituto Nacional de Tecnología Agropecuaria (INTA) está desarrollando una estrategia
de abordaje sobre los cultivos y medios de vidas afectados (perdidos o dañados).
results.summary: Argentina-Provincia de Salta-Emergencia Sociosanitaria-02/20 (ACTUALIZACIÓN)

actions_taken.summary: Actualmente hemos iniciado un monitoreo conjunto, de la mano de una estrategia de diplomacia humanitaria entre el estado y la oficina residente de Naciones Unidas. Un equipo se encuentra desplazado realizando una evaluación integral y posterior planificación de acciones.

results.description:
El 29 de Enero del 2020 la Provincia de Salta declaró por decreto la Emergencia Sociosanitaria para los departamentos de San Martín, Rivadavia y Orán, ubicados al noroeste de dicha provincia.
Al momento se han registrado 6 niños fallecidos por desnutrición y 10 menores de edad en situación de riesgo por agravamiento de la salud. Mientras que, el último fin de semana, fueron internados 26 niños con cuadros de desnutrición en el hospital zonal de Tartagal Juan Domingo Perón, ubicado en el Departamento de San Martín. El decreto tendrá vigencia en ´principio por un periodo de 180 días y apunta a cubrir las necesidades de alimentación, salud y agua segura de los pobladores del norte provincial, aunque con un plazo de inicio a 60 días (estimativo). 
La emergencia se declaró luego de la convocatoria a una mesa multisectorial que reunió a legisladores nacionales y provinciales, rectores de universidades y funcionarios para afrontar la situación del norte provincial.
Conjuntamente las condiciones meteorológicas no son propicias ya que las condiciones de sequía se agudizan en la región, dificultando el acceso al agua en calidad y cantidad, tanto para la población humana como los animales. Así también, sus cultivos, que en gran medida son utilizados para el consumo se están perdiendo.
Estas comunidades afectadas son en su mayoría pueblos originarios, caracterizadas por el auto abastecimiento. Es por ello que sus principales medios de vida se ven afectados por dichas condiciones.
Si bien muchas de estas problemáticas se pueden organizar en el carril de lo estructural, hay componentes emergentes que han desencadenado la crisis, uno de ellos, y quizás el más importante, es la situación económicamente crítica que se vive a nivel nacional.
results.actions_others: Las acciones tomadas al respecto, son aún muy primarias y de bajo impacto. La conformación de una mesa de actuación conjunta entre el estado provincial y el nacional, derivó en la potabilización limitada de agua y su posterior distribución, por parte del Ejército Argentino y el plan de entrega de tarjeta alimentaria (símil CTP) por parte del estado nacional, que aún se desconoce su aplicabilidad y con demora promedio a 60 días.
results.summary: Argentina-Provincia de Salta-Emergencia Sociosanitaria-02/20

results.description:
Procesos de educación comunitaria en municipios con mayor incidencia de casos con metodologías y materiales adecuados y considerando elementos de la participación comunitaria.
• Apoyo a la Capacitación de Filiales Municipales donde se tiene presencia y exista incidencia de casos presentados.
• Apoyo en aspectos logísticos (transporte, materiales de difusión, larvicidas, equipamiento de centros de salud) considerados en el Plan de Control de Dengue en complementariedad a las acciones que desarrolla el SEDES.
• Se reportó desde diferentes Centro de Salud de Primer Nivel que han sido colapsados los espacios destinados a la atención de pacientes con signos y síntomas de Dengue.

Procesos de educación comunitaria en municipios con mayor incidencia de casos con metodologías y materiales adecuados y considerando elementos de la participación comunitaria.
• Apoyo a la Capacitación de Filiales Municipales donde se tiene presencia y exista incidencia de casos presentados.
• Apoyo en aspectos logísticos (transporte, materiales de difusión, larvicidas, equipamiento de centros de salud) considerados en el Plan de Control de Dengue en complementariedad a las acciones que desarrolla el SEDES.
• Se reportó desde diferentes Centro de Salud de Primer Nivel que han sido colapsados los espacios destinados a la atención de pacientes con signos y síntomas de Dengue.
Cruz Roja Boliviana Filial Santa Cruz a través de su Sala de Situación activo la Alerta Amarilla y se encuentra coordinando con las diferentes áreas la implementación de actividades de monitoreo, planificación y operaciones en apoyo al control del Dengue.
• Se mantiene una coordinación estrecha con el COED Salud, Programa Dengue y SEDES a nivel departamental.
• A través del Área de Planificación y Operaciones de la Sala de Situación se mantiene coordinación con Filiales Municipales.
results.other_sources:
El ministro de Salud, Aníbal Cruz, reportó 1.234 casos confirmados de dengue en el país, en lo que va de la gestión 2020, por lo que se realiza un control epidemiológico para evitar la propagación de esa enfermedad, de acuerdo con la agencia ABI.

“Estamos con números altos, sí, pero aseguramos que no nos encontramos en el pico importante”.

Explicó que, si bien el país vive uno de los brotes más elevados de Latinoamérica, producto del cambio climático, se siguen los protocolos de seguridad que corresponden sobre esa enfermedad, que consideró cíclica.

En lo que va del año se registraron 5.062 casos sospechosos, principalmente en Santa Cruz, seguido de Cochabamba, Pando, Beni, Chuquisaca, Tarija y La Paz.

Confirmó que en 2020 fallecieron diez  personas por esa enfermedad (dos en Santa Cruz y una en Pando) y que esos pacientes tenían alguna patología de base que complicó su salud.

Recomendó acudir a un centro de salud en caso de tener los siguientes síntomas: fiebre, náuseas y vómitos, erupción en la piel, sangre en las encías y en la nariz, debilidad general, dolor muscular y articular, tos y dolor de garganta.

Se refirió al apoyo que se brinda desde su despacho a los municipios de los departamentos, en los que se registra mayor cantidad .

El representante de la Organización Panamericana de Salud y la Organización Mundial de Salud (OPS/OMS), Alfonso Tenorio, anunció que coadyuvará con dos expertos en la materia, para fortalecer las acciones de prevención, además de ayudar en el manejo clínico de los afectados.

A su juicio, el país se encuentra listo y cuenta con las condiciones para enfrentar el incremento de la enfermedad.
results.summary: 728 casos confirmados, 2668 casos sospechosos, con mayor incidencia en los Municipios de Santa Cruz,

countries_details.name: Democratic People's Republic of Korea

results.description:
Since the WHO confirmation of Novel Corona Virus spread in Wuhan China in early Jan 2020, the authorities in the DPRK were on alert, in early phase of epidemic alert however during the 3rd week of Jan 2020, the DPR Korea government has upgraded the Epidemic Alert level to Emergency Epidemic Alert level on Jan 20 and initiated four measures to prevent and control the spread of nCoV from neighbouring China;

  • Screening of suspected/at risk population
  • Early detection of cases – So far there has been no suspected or confirmed case in the country
  • Health and Hygiene promotion and information dissemination for the general population
  • Strengthening and activation of Quarantine facilities at border crossing points
  • To the prevention of the spreading of nCoV all the travellers including the staff of Diplomat Missions and International Organizations who enters to the territory of DPR Korea via the People’s Republic of China and via the Russian Federation passing by PRC must be quarantined in below mentioned places and have the medical observation for one month.
    •         By airline: Jangsusan Hotel, Phyongsong City, South Phyongan Province.
    •           Through the border or seaports with China or Russia: hotels nearest the entry point (In case through the entry point in Sinuiju City: Amnokgang Hotel, Sinuiju Ciry, North Phyongan Province).
  • MoPH requested WHO for testing equipment and materials for diagnose of the new virus.
  • Awareness campaign on nCoV carried on by the authorities including distribution of leaflets and coverage through TV and local newspapers.
  • The local/national staff of Diplomatic Missions and International Organization has been put under quarantine/isolation with respective offices in diplomatic compound.
  • All members of Diplomatic Missions and Intranational Organizations and their visitors arriving in the country after Jan 13, 2020 are quarantined for a period of 14 days in their residences in diplomatic compound and not allowed to leave the compound.
  • During the month of February, all kinds of events, courtesy calls, and meetings shall not take place. All essential meetings shall be communicated via telephone or other alternate measures.
results.actions_others:
Summary of the DPRK RCS  response:

Since the very beginning (as early as Jan 20) DPRK RCS Secretary General has activated the National Disaster Response Team  for the monitoring of the situation in coordination with Dep. of External Affairs, State Hygiene Inspection & Control Board and MoPH. The NS in response to the request from the health department, has mobilised its 500 (female: 315, male: 185) volunteers in 4 provinces close to Chinese border. These volunteers are trained in  ECV  with the focus on nCoV. These volunteers are working closely with the  Household doctors, for house to house screening of people, health and personal hygiene promotion. The local branch staff is supporting these volunteers on regular basis. The RC volunteers are coordinating with local health staff and government departments for broad community engagement and visiting individual households who live remotely and can’t be routinely reached out.

DPRK RCS activated the “volunteers on wheels initiative” by having the volunteers using about 700 bicycles, provided under this initiative, to reach the last mile of the remote areas and disseminate the nCoV awareness message.   

DPRK RCS is also coordinating with local stakeholders while IFRC is responsible for coordinating with the other international organisations. Below are the activities taken by DPRK RCS: 1) National Disaster Response Teams (NDRT) and Provincial Disaster Response Teams (PDRT) are alerted, they are on 24 hours standby, ready to provide timely and efficient response; 2) The NS has received training curriculum for Novel Corona virus prevention from MoPH for refresher training of 500 RC Volunteers in 4 provinces; 3) RC Volunteer mobilization plan shared with the local authorities in 9 cities and counties; 4) Revised and updated contingency plan for nCoV outbreak for DPRK RCS; 5) The NDRT and 9 PDRTs of DPRK RCS were activated and alerted, while keeping the liaison each other to share 24-hour surveillance information ;6) Community based RC volunteers who already trained on CBHFA and ECV were mobilized to prevent the spread of nCoV in the areas close to Chinese border and in cooperation with community health institutions.

No country specific DREF launched as planned initially and instead one Global Emergency Appeal on Coronavirus has been launched by the IFRC Secretariat in Geneva and release one million CHF as DREF, see EA attached of 31st Jan. Therefore, under this DREF loan, CHF 40K have been allocated to support DPRK initial preparedness/response. Although this amount it is not enough it will depend on the funds for the appeal that will guide us if more funds will be allocated to DPRK.

Regarding the needs of DPRK RC, as shared with by the NS. Similar information has reached through different means. IFRC would be happy to coordinate with all CAS members to see if any NS would  be willing to provide in-kind donation or cash donation for such procurements. Some partners already in contact with us in this regard.

The Federation country office delegates and local staff are supporting the NS remotely with latest updates, technical support and resources, Sitreps etc. as CO staff is confined to diplomatic compound since Jan 31 until Feb 15, 2020.”
results.summary: DPR Korea: Covid-19 (Update#01)

results.description:
Siendo las 17:30 Se activa Estado de Catástrofe para la Región de Atacama, Municipios de Copiapo, Tierra Amarilla, Diego de Almagro, Chañaral y Alto del Carmen.

En considerando los antecedentes, la Intendencia de la Región de Atacama, en coordinación con la Dirección Regional de ONEMI actualiza la Alerta Amarilla para las comunas de Copiapó, Tierra Amarilla, Diego de Almagro, Chañaral y Alto del Carmen, por evento meteorológico, que se mantiene vigente desde el 27 de enero de 2020.

el Servicio Nacional de Geología y Minería (SERNAGEOMIN) reportó 03 eventos de remociones en masa en las cuencas de los ríos Salado, Copia y Huasco. Además, se señala que habiendo ocurrido lo anterior, la probabilidad de ocurrencia de otros eventos de remoción en masa es Alta a Muy Alta en todo el sector cordillerano de la región, mientras se mantenga la ocurrencia de precipitaciones en la zona.
results.actions_others: Gobierno: Se ha decretado estado de Catástrofe para la región de Atacama, esto permitirá la movilización de recursos regionales,adicional a ello, Ha dispuesto de personal militar para la asistencia de personas. despliegue de equipos con maquinaria pesada, COE regional ha comenzado a coordinar acciones preventivas para la evacuación de familias de los municipios afectados, el Municipio local se encuentra entregando lonas a las comunidades para recubrimiento de viviendas y enceres.
results.other_sources:
De momento se encuentran evacuados los municipios de Altos del Carmen (3 Localidades), y el Municipio de Chañaral (1 Localidad).
El Gobierno ha activado alertas de evacuación preventiva para las localidad afectadas por las lluvias (mensajería SAE) iniciados la noche de ayer 27 de enero del 2020.
results.summary: Evento Meteorológico

results.description:
Since the beginning of the cold wave that has hit Palestine since the 18 January, 2020, the populations in various areas of the Palestinian Territory are suffering from the harsh consequences, especially floods in the Gaza Strip, the Jordan valley, areas around the separation wall in addition to other vulnerable areas across the West Bank.
The cold wave was exceptional in its nature, with very strong winds and rains, and temperature very low for Palestine.
The Palestinian Government has called for collaboration and common efforts to support the affected populations to face the current challenges since PRCS is a member of the High Council of Civil Defence that was initiated by the Palestinian authorities and has long been supporting the Civil Defence in contingency planning.

Responding to the situation, PRCS has undertaken Rapid Needs Assessment and revised the Vulnerability and Capacity Assessment (VCA) that were previously prepared to better respond 
to the crisis. After intensive consultations with the various actors in the field such as Palestinian  civil defence & Ministry of Health, and based on the immediate responses to the humanitarian calls, PRCS has been able to identify the needs of the community in facing this cold wave, both in the West Bank and the Gaza Strip with  activating the operation Room 24/24  . 
The PRCS has deployed 600 volunteers who will running the operation together with technical staff from Disaster Management unit, Logistic, PSP and EMS.
Volunteers are included under the IFRC insurance system and the cost of their meals and transportation will include under this DREF operation.

In general The conducted needs assessment focused on the Relief and Shelter, on the one hand the needs of Non-Food Items (NFI), including: Tarpaulins, Tents, Plastic Sheets, Hygiene Kits, Kitchen Kits , Mattresses, and Blankets among several other items. On the other hand, the costs of the logistics, fuel for vehicles, food and transportation of volunteers who will participate in the intervention in the various areas.

At least 30000 remain vulnerable during the winter weather and may need further assistance
The PRCS is expecting to benefit a total of 2000 families in the current response, 1500 families in the Gaza Strip and 500 families in the West Bank during a period of three months. 

Since the onset of the emergency there has been ongoing coordination between PRCS, the Palestinian Civil defence, local and national authorities, including governorates and municipalities, UN agencies as well as within the RCRC Movement.
Furthermore PRCS is a member of the Palestinian Civil Defence and the Governorates in cooperation There are 5 core field assessors who are also the focal points tasked with inputting needs information into the online system, these are: OCHA, UNRWA, the Civil Defence, Governorates and PRCS.

The DREF will  aim to replenishment of PRCS stocks for what has been distributed so far, and the immediate purchase and distribution of additional items for the continuation of the emergency. Thus as the on-going operation is benefitting from previous stocks, the DREF support help ensure preparedness and immediate response in future response.
results.actions_others:
Early actions taken by the Palestinian government -the highest council of the civil defence:
1- Conduct an emergency meeting to all relevant actors such as PRCS to discuss the preparedness/contingency plans to better response ,since the highest council considered this cold wave as level  three .
2- Scanning the needed NFI & food items  in all expected affected areas through the local & village councils .
3- conduct an emergency meeting with Ministry of health to verify the contingency/emergency plans .
4- consider 22-1-2020 as vacation day for schools in all palestine  by a presidential decision due to the heavy rains & expected floods consequently.
4- conduct a meeting with meteorological department to discuss the latest update of the weather  to warn the citizens through the ministry of communication & the several social media .
results.other_sources:
The source details for the above mentioned informations is  as follows:
1- the highest council for the Palestinian Civil Defence
2- Emergency committees in local & village councils
3-PRCS branches in affected governorates 
4- PRCS National Response Teams
results.summary: Palestine Cold Wave 2020

event_details.name: Three dead as Yellow Fever outbreak is confirmed in Uganda

results.description:
The Ugandan Ministry of Health has confirmed an outbreak of Yellow Fever following investigations of two suspect cases that were first reported in Buliisa District in mid-western part of the country in October 2019 as well as two recent cases reported in Moyo district in Northern Uganda.  This brings to four cases confirmed through laboratory tests conducted at the Uganda Virus Research Institute (UVRI) in Entebbe, Uganda. 
However, epidemiological investigations has established that these are not localized outbreaks but rather all the four cases seem to have been imported from the neighboring countries of the Democratic Republic of Congo (DRC) and South Sudan, while the two cases who died in Moyo district were timber traders suspected to have contracted the disease in South Sudan where they were operating. 
The two confirmed cases in Moyo, which is a border district with South Sudan are both males, aged 18 and 21 years who were admitted at Logobo Health Center III in Moyo district on January 3, 2020, with symptoms of fever, vomiting, diarrhoea, fatigue, headache, abdominal and joint pain, confusion and unexplained bleeding, but unfortunately later passed-on on referral to the isolation facility at Moyo General Hospital. 
The other two confirmed cases; a 37-year-old male cattle farmer and his wife were traders of milk between Uganda and the Democratic Republic of Congo reported to Bulliisa hospital on 31st October 2020 with complaint of headache, vomiting and abdominal pain for which he received supportive treatment, but unfortunately later died. Their laboratory samples tested positive for the Yellow Fever virus on 22 January 2020.
results.actions_others:
The Ministry of Health and the World Health Organization (WHO) have dispatched Rapid Response Teams (RRTs) to the affected districts to support investigations, active search for cases, and initiate community mobilization and sensitization actions. 
The Government  has also submitted a request for Yellow Fever vaccines from the International Coordination Group (ICG)  and anticipate vaccination exercise targeting those at risk in Moyo and Buliisa districts will commence within the next two weeks. 
As four outbreaks of Yellow Fever had previously been reported in Uganda, the Ministry of Health had already applied to the Global Vaccine Alliance (GAVI) and the WHO to permit the Yellow Fever vaccination to be included into its routine immunization schedule.
results.other_sources: Press Briefing by Minister of Health  and WHO, as well as National Task Force (NTF) meeting epidemiological update
results.summary: Three dead as Yellow Fever outbreak is confirmed in Uganda

results.description:
Madagascar a connu des fortes précipitation depuis le 19 janvier 2020 au 23 Janvier 2020. Cela a affecté lourdement la grande Ile avec 92 983 sinistrés repartis dans 07 régions notamment : Diana, Boeny, Sofia, Melaky, Analamanga, Alaotra Mangoro, Betsiboka.
Une déclaration de sinistre national par le premier ministre, chef du gouvernement ce 24 Janvier 2020.
Depuis l'alerte de vigilance lancé par le DGM jusqu'à maintenant, la Croix Rouge Malagasy soutiens la population Malagasy à travers des activités de préparation, d'évacuation, de soutien psycho social.
Des évaluations de dégâts et des besoins  sont en cours pour la région Alaotra Mangoro, Melaky, Boeny, Sofia  et le centre opérationnel de la Croix Rouge Malagasy est activé.
Tous ces activités sont réalisés à travers   nos volontaires locaux.  
Nous pensons à demander  des appuis technique et financier à nos partenaires pour pouvoir assurer et apporter nos soutiens aux personnes sinistrées.

event_details.name: Niger: Mouvement de populations dans la région de Tillaberi

results.description: Suite à l'attaque du camp militaire de Chinagodar dans le département de Banibangou (région de Tillaberi) par des groupes armés non étatiques intervenue le 14 janvier 2020 et ayant occasionné la mort de plus de 80 militaires, on a assisté à un déplacement massif des populations vers certaines localités du Niger mais aussi du Mali. Ces mouvements continuent encore et se sont étendu à l’ensemble des villages de la zone. De nouveaux déplacements ont été enregistrés hier 23 janvier 2020 avec l’arrivée à Ouallam de nouveaux ménages.  le nombre total de ménages est évalué à 1163 ménages soient 7076 personnes déplacées parmi lesquels figurent plus de 500 enfants de moins de cinq ans,  100 femmes cheffe de ménages et de personnes âgées.  Les déplacés ont été accueillis dans des endroits de fortunes comme les centres publiques où ils survivent dans des conditions particulièrement pitoyables dans cette période de mauvais temps (froid, poussière, vent) les exposant ainsi aux risques de maladies respiratoires.  Le contexte sécuritaire demeure toujours critique. Au vu de la situation actuelle et de son évolution, Les besoins humanitaires urgents des sinistrés sont exprimés en termes d’abris, de santé, d’eau hygiène et assainissement et en bien non alimentaires.
results.actions_others: Le Gouvernement à mis à la disposition les lieux d'accueil pour héberger les déplacés. iL coordonne avec les partenaires humanitaires pour venir en aide aux sinistrés.
results.summary: Niger: Mouvement de populations dans la région de Tillaberi

event_details.name: Locust Invasion in Kenya - A risk to food supply

results.description:
The locust invasion in Kenya was first reported on 28th December 2019 with an influx of the pests seen in some regions of Somalia bordering northern Kenya. As reported by the Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO) that the locusts had destroyed about 175,000 acres (70,000 hectares) of farmland in Somalia and Ethiopia before moving into Kenya and that the risk of locust movement into Uganda and South Sudan is likely. 
Earlier in the month of December, the FAO had warned that the locusts would spread to other East African countries if measures were not taken to stop the invasion. The swarms later invaded parts of Northern Kenya in Mandera and Wajir Counties from January 2020. Both immature and maturing swarms continue to arrive in the North-East from Ethiopia and Somalia and are spreading throughout the northern counties of Mandera, Wajir and Marsabit.  They have also recently reached central Kenya areas of Isiolo, Meru North and Northern Laikipia.  Some swarms in the North have moved back to Southern Ethiopia while others are now mature and laying eggs that are expected to hatch after about two weeks, giving rise to hopper bands in February and March this year.  On 20th January, a swarm reached the Southern Rift Valley area near Kapedo on the border of Baringo and Turkana Counties.  Further movements are expected, especially in Turkana, Samburu and Marsabit Counties.
results.actions_others: Aerial and ground control operations are in progress in most of these areas led by the Kenyan National Government through the ministry of Agriculture, Livestock, fisheries and cooperative.  The current locust situation is extremely alarming and represents an unprecedented threat to food security and livelihoods in North and North Eastern Kenya.
results.other_sources: Assessments carried by KRCS as well as FAO reports
results.summary: Locust Invasion in Kenya - A risk to food supply

event_details.name: Heavy snowfall, rain and sliding  in Pakaistan (Baluchistan, Azad Kashmir  and KP  )

results.description: From 11th to 13th Jan 2020 several parts of Pakistan faced heavy rains, heaviest snow fall, flash floods, avalanches and landslides. 106 persons have been reported as dead throughout Pakistan. Among them 20 reported dead in Baluchistan, 05 in KP, 2 in GB and 79 has been confirmed by State Disaster Management Authority AJK. Roads are still blocked in many areas in AJK and Baluchistan and the situation will be cleared by later today. Assessment reports are still awaited from many areas and there is possibility that losses and damage figure will increase. The provincial government of Baluchistan has declared a state of emergency in 11 districts and requested NDMA via letter dated 13 January to allow humanitarian organizations to support PDMA to reach out the people in need. The situation in different areas is as follows:- A. AJK: i. In Azad Jammu & Kashmir (AJK) the worst affected district is Neelum (Extreme North District of AJK) due to heavy snowfall, rain & avalanche resultantly caused 79 x dead with more than 202 x houses Completely destroyed. Upper parts of Neelum are disconnected with DHQ Neelum ii. Neelum Valley Rd at Sharda onwards, leepa Valley Rd at Reshiyan and Haji peer Rd at Aliabad are blocked. B. Baluchistan: i. On 11 January 2020 in different areas of Baluchistan, heavy snowfall and rains reported and the spell continued until 13 January 2019. Damages to lives, property and livestock has been reported in mass level. Govt. of Baluchistan/PDMA has declared emergency in 11 districts of Baluchistan i.e Quetta, Killa Abdullah, Pishin, Killa Saifullah, Kalat, Ziarat, Loralai, Harnai, Kacchi, Mastung, Kharan. Turbat. The heaviest snowfall two feet was recorded by the Pakistan Meteorological Department (PMD) in Ziarat, while Quetta and Zhob each received more than a foot of snow. Quetta, Ziarat, Harnoi, Kan Mehtarzai, Muslim Bagh, Khanozai and Khojak Pass were blanketed in snow. Due to heavy snowfall initially the Highways, Quetta-Sibi, Quetta-Karachi and Quetta-Zhob were blocked but open for traffic. In District Kharan, Panjgoor and Gwadar heavy rains are reported which resulted to flash flooding in different area of mentioned district. In total 56mm rainfall, was recorded in Turbat, 40mm in Pasni and 26 mm in Pishin. C. Gilgit Baltistan: i. Astor Valley has received a record-breaking snow in some areas breaking 100 years record (Media and GBDMA). In total 2 died due to avalanche while 4 got injured. The snow has paralyzed life in the region, with residents in northern valleys restricted to their homes. Gilgit Baltistan authorities mobilized all their resources to open the blocked roads and to assist the people in need. Since the region is cut off from the rest of the country, local hospitals are facing shortage of medicines. ii. All major roads are clear for traffic however, work is in progress to clear link/valley roads. D. Khyber-Pakhtunkhwa (KP): i. KP is also in the grip of cold wave. Rain and snowfall continued in Hazara and Malakand divisions, Kohat, Orakzai and Chitral. All access roads to Chitral, including the Lowari Tunnel, are blocked while water and electricity supplies are disrupted. j. Kalash Valley Rd and Drosh Rd un Lower Chitral ,Mastuj Rd in upper Chitral, Shangla Gali Rd in district AbbotAbad and MNJ Road in District Mansehra are blocked.
results.actions_others:
Response from Government/Other Humanitarian Actors: SDMA/DDMA/District Administration/Health Department:
Response:

 Weather alerts were timely issued to all concerned by NDMA.
 Immediate Rescue Operations launched by SDMA/PDMA/GBDMA District Administration and Pakistan Army. 3 x helicopters from Army Aviation were coordinated for rescue and relief operations in affected areas of AJK while 2X Bell Helis were deployed for evacuation in Mand area and Nakundi sector district Chaghi by NDMA.
 High alert has been sent to local officials and rescue teams in their respective regions where up to four feet of snowfall has been reported so far.
 A Special Emergency Desk has been set up in the State Disaster Management Authority to monitor the situation (AJK) and DDMA Neelum is functional and monitoring the situation at district level.
 Govt. of Pakistan Administered Kashmir declared Neelum, Leepa Valley and Bhadi as disastrous areas, the notification has been issued on Monday (20 Jan 2020)  The Government of AJK is providing death claim compensation at the rate of PKR 150,000/person, and compensation for injured PKR 70,000/person.
 For the damaged houses the government is providing compensation at the rate of PKR. 100,000 for fully damaged and PKR. 40,000/ for partially damaged house.
 An amount of PKR: 500,000 will be extended to the next of kin/legal heir of every deceased person as Ex Gratia announced by NDMA chairman from the Prime Minister of Pakistan Assistance Package for the affected population of Baluchistan while Rupees 50,000 will be paid to the injured ones and rupees 100,000 will be provided for the families with houses fully damaged or collapsed.
results.other_sources: PRCS Rapid assessment report,National disaster Management authority (NDMA),Local media & UN OCHA
results.summary: Sit rep 4,Heavy rain,heaviest snowfall,avalanches,flash flood &land slides ,(Baluchistan,AJK and KP)

results.description:
Lassa fever is an acute viral haemorrhagic illness of 2-21 days duration that occurs in West Africa. According to WHO, the Lassa virus is transmitted to humans via contact with food or household items contaminated with rodent urine or faeces. Person-to-person infections and laboratory transmission can also occur, particularly in hospitals lacking adequate infection prevention and control measures.
the recent outbreak he outbreak has caused panic in the affected states, with many residents in fear that the disease might spread to other parts of the states and escalate beyond control. members of the public have been sensitized to maintain adequate food, water and personal hygiene, report any suspected case of lass fever and maintain key preventive measures to stay safe.
results.actions_others: The country's Lassa fever Technical Working Group continues to coordinate the response activities at the national level with on/offsite collaboration of MDAs. Confirmed cases are treated at identified treatment centres across the states with Ribavirin and necessary supportive management also instituted. there is Enhanced surveillance (contact tracing and active case finding) in affected states as well as Monitoring outbreak intensity.
results.other_sources: The Nigeria Centre or Disease Control confirms that in week 03 of 2020, the number of new confirmed cases has increased from 64 cases in week 1, 2020 to 81.  These were reported from six states (Ondo, Edo, Delta, Taraba, Plateau, and Bauchi). The number of deaths has decreased. So far, the overall case fatality rate (CFR) for 2020 is (14.7%). In total for 2020, 398 cases of Lassa Fever have been reported with 163 confirmed cases. Nine states have recorded at least one confirmed case across 32 Local Government Areas. 89% of all confirmed cases are from Edo (38%), Ondo (38%) and Ebonyi (11%) states.The predominant age-group affected is 11-40 years (Range: >11 to 60 years, Median Age: 33 years).
results.summary: Outbreak of Lassa Fever

actions_taken.summary: Busia Red Cross Branch has so far mobilized 20 volunteers who are supporting the District Local Government who are involved in the public sensitization about adoption of safer hygiene practices and also disinfecting the houses of the suspected cases as a strategy for Infection Prevention and Control (IPC).

The IFRC country office is monitoring the evolution of the situation and reviewing contingency stock of Oral Rehydration Point (ORP) kits for immediate deployment to support community case management, if warranted and planning to provide required support to the Uganda Red Cross Society's response actions, should the situation escalate further.

event_details.name: 12 Hospitalized after confirmed cholera outbreak in Busia Municipality

results.description:
12 people, including 9 males and 3 females from Solo A, Solo B, Sofia villages in the Western Division as well as and Mawero East B village in the Eastern Division of Busia Municipality have been admitted at Busia Health Centre IV since Thursday 16/01/2020 following a new episode of cholera outbreak which was confirmed by the Ministry of Health on 17th January 2020. Two of the the total number of cases were confirmed at the Public Health Laboratory in Mbale Regional referral Hospital, while the other 10 remain as suspect cases.  No death has been recorded yet from this outbreak. 
Busia district is perennially affected by cholera due to the poor sanitation and safe water coverage, coupled with the poor hygiene behaviours majorly of persons living in congested informal settlements/slum areas of the Municipality and fishing villages along Lake Victoria. 
The busy economic activities, exacerbated by the high population mobility along the border town might worsen the situation, evolving further and spreading the infection to other high-risk communities including Bulumbi and Majanji sub-counties.
results.actions_others: The District Health Office is providing treatment of all suspect cases. One district task force meeting has been held at Busia Health Centre IV which the Isolation facility is established to understand the critical gaps and design effective response strategies that rapidly assists to disrupt further spread of the outbreak.
results.other_sources: The reported number of cases are from from the Epidemiological data of Busia District Health Office as at 19 January 2019
results.summary: 12 Hospitalized after confirmed cholera outbreak in Busia Municipality

El Instituto Guatemalteco de Migración registró 662 personas ingresando por la Aduana de Corinto, Izabal y 1612 por la Aduana de Agua Caliente, Chiquimula, ambos al noreste de Guatemala. Rutas utilizadas: 1. Frontera Agua Caliente 2. Frontera del Corinto Durante el día del 15 de enero se registró un aproximado de 600 personas en tránsito, por la noche se registraron 160 personas en Casa del Migrante Esquipulas, Guatemala y un aproximado de 800 personas pernoctaron en el departamento de Ocotepeque, Honduras. A partir del 16 de enero, la Policía Nacional Civil en Guatemala ha iniciado un Plan de Retorno de personas hondureñas que no hayan cumplido con el registro aduanero correspondiente. Con un posible escenario de sobrepasar las 5 mil personas ingresando por las fronteras Honduras - Guatemala, la Sociedad Nacional alertaría la activación de fondos de emergencia. La Sociedad Nacional puso en marcha su plan de acción a partir del 14 de enero con los siguientes servicios: asistencia en primeros auxilios, apoyo psicosocial, RCF y orientación en las rutas. 3. Hasta el día de hoy el Instituto Guatemalteco de Migración reporta un
total de 3, 543 personas que han ingresado de diferente forma a nuestro
país.
4. Hasta el día de hoy se atendido un total de 464 pacientes (Mialgias,
Infecciones Respiratorias Agudas Superiores, Cefaleas, Neuralgias y
Neuritis no especificadas entre otras.)
5. El distrito de Salud de Ayutla San Marcos, ha atendido 108 paciente.
6. El distrito de Ayutla San Marcos tiene habilitado 2 clínicas que funcionan
como puesto de atención en el lugar.
7. Como parte del “Plan Institucional de Actuación de Salud Publica para
eventos masivos de Migración Internacional Irregular” se instalo 1 clínica
Móvil en Tecun Uman, Municipio de Ayutla,DAS San Marcos.


Respuesta Humanitaria
• La Coordinadora Residente con el Equipo de País de Naciones Unidas -UNCT-, acordaron la activación del Plan 
de Contingencia relacionado a Movilidad Humana.
Protección
Necesidades:
• Identificación de necesidades de protección internacional de aquellas personas que podrían calificar como 
refugiadas 
• Información sobre derechos y responsabilidades en Guatemala, alternativas para su permanecer y para un 
retorno seguro. Así como información sobre las posibilidades de ingresar a México. 
• Respuesta integral a las personas que van en la caravana, bajo un enfoque diferenciado de atención humanitaria 
de acuerdo con las necesidades que presenten los niños, niñas, mujeres, adultos mayores, personas con retos 
especiales y otros grupos vulnerables. Así mismo que se les brinde la atención por parte del servicio consular 
en Guatemala, México y EE. UU.
espuesta:
• El sector de Protección co-liderado por ACNUR y OACNUDH, ha coordinado a fin de compartir información, 
hacer un mapeo rápido de acciones de respuesta, necesidades humanitarias y priorizar acciones. 
• ACNUR ha tenido presencia con personal de campo en Aguas Calientes, Ciudad Capital, Izabal, Peten y 
juntamente con OACNUDH en Tecún Umán.
• Organizaciones de la sociedad civil, entre ellas, Casa del Migrante, Misioneros Scalabrinianos, Cruz Roja 
Guatemalteca, Pastoral de Movilidad Humana, Lambda entre otros han brindado gran parte de la respuesta 
humanitaria que consistió en proporcionar alimentos, atención médica, información sobre derechos y albergue. 
Se estima que 2000 personas habrían cruzado por Esquipulas y 500 por Corinto. 
• El Instituto Guatemalteco de Migración en Esquipulas registró a las personas que entraron a través de la frontera 
de Agua Caliente. A las personas se les da un ticket sellado por IGM que les permite transitar y salir del país en 
72 horas.
• Los actores humanitarios que se han movilizado a las diferentes áreas para brindar apoyo son la Casa del 
Migrante José ubicada en Esquipulas, Casa del Migrante en Ciudad de Guatemala y Tecún Umán, la Pastoral 
de Movilidad Humana, Cruz Roja Guatemalteca, Asociación Lambda, Corazón Migrante en Tecún Umán y el 
Albergue Raíces de Amor de Refugio de la Niñez. Las entidades gubernamentales que han estuvieron presentes
en la frontera son: Procuraduría de los Derechos Humanos, Secretaría de Obras Sociales de la Esposa del 
presidente, Procuraduría General de la Nación, Ministerio Público, Policía Nacional Civil y DIPAFRONT, 
Ministerio de Salud Pública y Asistencia Social, y Municipalidad de Esquipulas.
• Acciones de apoyo de UNICEF a los sectores de Protección Infantil. Más de 151 niños y niñas han sido atendidos 
por los servicios de Protección Infantil.
• UNICEF está apoyando a la Fiscalía de Derechos Humanos, la Procuraduría General de la Nación y la 
Secretaría de Bienestar Social con brigadas de vigilancia de oficiales de protección para identificar a los niños
no acompañados e iniciar el proceso de protección. Se activaron cuñas radiofónicas a través de las emisoras 
comunitarias para la protección de la violencia contra los migrantes y se entregó material informativo a las 
familias de los migrantes sobre cómo cuidar a los niños y niñas en el camino, también está suministrando 
colchones inflables, mantas y botiquines de higiene.
Albergues
Necesidades:
• El albergue en la Casa del Migrante ubicada en la zona 1 de la capital, a donde llegan los migrantes a pernoctar 
es insuficiente para atender a la cantidad de migrantes que han llegado buscando cobijo. Se han instalado 
carpas enfrente del inmueble las cuales ya están saturadas y las personas descansan en las calles. El espacio 
es insuficiente y ha rebasado la capacidad de este albergue, han solicitado ayuda a entidades de gobierno para 
habilitar albergues y buses. 
Respuesta:
• ACNUR asiste a la Municipalidad de Esquipulas y Tecún Umán para encontrar espacios que puedan servir de 
albergues. Se han entregado kit de higiene, insumos para albergues, artículos de limpieza y alimentos no 
perecederos (ver cuadro en anexo).
• Por parte del sector de Protección se han elaborado mensajes las personas de la caravana que contienen 
información sobre sus derechos y contactos e información para ayuda.
• Por parte de las autoridades han confirmado que habilitarán un albergue en el parque Érick Barrondo, en la zona 
7 de la capital, para que los migrantes sean atendidos esta noche.
• Casa del Migrante Tecún Umán en la noche del 16 de enero acogió a 250 personas. El 17 de enero la Casa del 
Migrante Tecún Umán acogió a 500 personas.
• ACNUR y la Municipalidad de Tecún Umán han identificado un lugar que pueda funcionar como albergue 
temporal, ha gestionado 2 carpas de 22 mts x 9 mts, que pueden proporcionar sombra a 600 personas. La 
municipalidad ha puesto a disposición 300 cobijas, 300 mantas plásticas, 300 lámparas y 5 eco-filtros donados 
en 2019 por ACNUR. La municipalidad también proporcionará luz, limpieza de terreno y recolección de basura, 
con apoyo de combustible de ACNUR. La PNC proporcionará seguridad. Corazón Migrante proporcionará 4 
voluntarios para administrar el albergue temporal de 17.00 a 06.00am. 
• Cruz Roja Guatemalteca, apoyará con la administración del albergue en la zona 1.

Salud
Necesidades: 
• Las principales causas de atención se encuentran asociados a problemas respiratorios, lesiones en la piel,
Hipertensión, Diabetes, traumatismos, Luxaciones, torceduras y esguinces que afectan múltiples regiones del 
(de los) miembros(s) inferior(es).
• Las personas presentan cuadros de deshidratación, hipertensión arterial, fiebre, infecciones gastrointestinales,
dolores musculares y heridas o ampollas en las extremidades inferiores. Por lo que se necesitan suero para 
niños, jarabes para problemas estomacales, y respiratorios, medicamentos básicos como ibuprofeno, 
acetaminofén, vendas, crema lasar, loratadina, tijeras quirúrgicas, hibitane, pomadas para hongos, llagas, 
sueros en polvo, alcohol, algodón, curitas, AlkaSeltzer, kit de primeros auxilios
Respuesta:
• Desde el 15 de enero, Cruz Roja Guatemalteca ha estado presente en la frontera Agua Caliente, para brindar 
asistencia humanitaria a las personas, brindando atención a 1,655 personas en atención prehospitalaria, 925 
per. apoyo psicosocial y 208 en primeros auxilios psicológicos, 284 restablecimiento de contacto entre familiares, 
acompañamiento de personas a la Casa del Migrante, y el monitoreo con ambulancia en la ruta de Esquipulas 
hacia Chiquimula. Voluntarios capacitados han sido desplegados a los puestos de socorro instalados por Cruz 
Roja Guatemalteca en la frontera Corinto en el departamento de Izabal, Agua Caliente en el departamento de 
Chiquimula, Frontera la Técnica y en la aldea Santa Elena en el departamento de Petén y en la Frontera de 
Tecún Umán en el departamento de San Marcos para brindar una respuesta oportuna a las personas que llegan 
con problemas de deshidratación, hipertensión, infecciones respiratorias y gastrointestinales, dolores 
musculares y heridas en pies. El centro de operaciones de emergencias de Cruz Roja Guatemalteca se 
mantiene en constante monitoreo de la situación. 
• En Casa del Migrante José, en Esquipulas, estuvo presente personal del Centro de Salud del Ministerio de Salud 
Pública y Asistencia Social para cuidados prehospitalarios. De ser necesario, trasladaron a personas al Centro 
de Salud.
• Ministerio de salud activo el “Plan de Respuesta de Salud Pública para eventos masivos de migración 
internacional irregular” y con el apoyo de OPS activo el COE-Salud
• Ministerio de Salud emitió circular a directores de hospitales y de Área para alertar y activar acciones de 
preparación y respuesta a los servicios de salud ubicados en la ruta migratoria. Envió una clínica móvil para la 
atención de personas en el punto fronterizo de Tecún Umán en el Departamento de San Marcos.
• La Oficina de País activo comité de crisis. OPS/OMS ha llevado a cabo acciones de acompañamiento técnico 
al Ministerio de Salud para la respuesta. También se tiene participación en los espacios de coordinación de 
Naciones Unidas para la respuesta al flujo masivo de personas. 
• Se acompaño al ministro de salud y su equipo a una vista de verificación en la Casa del migrante ubicada en la 
ciudad de Guatemala, donde se activó Un Módulo de Estabilización Medica.
• Durante el fin de semana conjuntamente con personal del Ministerio de Salud se hará visita al punto fronterizo 
de Tecun Umán para evaluación y análisis de necesidades en Salud y se entregaran kit de Higiene. 
Agua, Saneamiento e Higiene
Necesidades:
• De acuerdo a evaluaciones preliminares se necesita: agua purificada, kit de higiene, toallas sanitarias, jabón, 
desodorante, papel higiénico, pañales.
Respuesta:
• CONRED atenderá con 8,950 bosas de agua en la casa del Migrante en Ayutla y ACNUR pondrá 10 sanitarios 
portátiles en el Ceibo 
• Cruz Roja Guatemalteca facilitó la distribución de agua para consumo a 1,712 personas.

Seguridad Alimentaria
Necesidades:
• Raciones calientes para adultos y niños. El alimento preparado podrá ser entregado en los albergues.
• En coordinación con el clúster de Albergues, necesidad de contar con wiikhalls portátiles listas para armar y 
utilizar en los puntos que el gobierno designe.
Respuesta:
• Por parte del Programa Mundial de Alimentos -PMA- se realizó una misión al municipio de Ayutla ciudad Tecún 
Umán a la frontera de Guatemala con México para evaluar las necesidades de alimentación y potenciales 
proveedores de comidas servidas. Está evaluando las posibilidades de asistencia en la frontera de Tecún Umán. 
• 2 Wiikhalls portátiles de dimensión de 10 metros de ancho por 24 metros de largo, que podrán albergar a 
personas se trasladaron a Tecún Umán. 
• Cruz Roja Guatemalteca apoyo con distribución de merienda a 1,352. 
Coordinación
El 15 de enero se activo Plan de Alerta Temprana y Respuesta para movimientos grandes de personas, aprobado 
en 2019 a través del clúster de protección (500 personas es el umbral acordado para su activación).
El 17 de enero el vicepresidente convocó a una reunión de alto nivel en la que participaron entidades estatales, la 
Coordinadora Residente y las agencias líderes de los sectores/cluster de seguridad alimentaria, salud, agua,
saneamiento e higiene, protección y albergues, con el fin de apoyar acciones para la respuesta a las necesidades 
humanitarias que sufren las personas que se desplazan en flujos mixtos. Durante la reunión se recomendó 
coordinación entre el gobierno central y gobiernos locales de Ayutla-San Marcos, Guatemala y Peten, activar el 
sistema de respuesta a emergencias de la Coordinadora Nacional para la Reducción de Desastres -CONRED- y 
realizan una visita de alto nivel Gobierno y Sistema de Naciones Unidas a Tecún Umán participando Juana 
Sotomayor de OACNUDH, Amalia Amaya representante a.i, OPS/OMS, Julio Carranza UN Coordinador Residente 
a.i.,, Rebeca Cenalmor, representante de ACNUR y por parte de Vicepresidencia va el secretario particular del 
Vicepresidente Juan José Cabrera.
Hay equipos interagenciales técnicos conformados por PMA/OPS/ACNUR/OACNUDH.
En reunión de UNCT se ha se han activado los siguientes grupos sectoriales/grupos nacionales:
• Agua, saneamiento e higiene (WASH) (UNICEF)
• Seguridad Alimentaria (PMA)
• Salud (PAHO/OPS)
• Protección (Coordinadores: ACNUR/ACNUDH) / Subgrupo de Protección de la Infancia (UNICEF)
• Albergues (OIM)
También se ha activado el UNDMT (United Nations Disaster Management Team y el UNETE (UN Emergency 
Technical Team los cuales se mantienen en monitoreo permanente y compartiendo información sobre la situación.
El Equipo Humanitario de País se mantiene compartiendo información sobre la situación a través de los diversos 
sectores activos y atentos a las solicitudes de apoyo.
results.summary: Flujo Masivo de Personas Migrantes

actions_taken.summary:
PRCS Response: 
PRCS-PHQs disaster response teams through dedicated volunteers receiving initial assessment reports & information from affected districts and delivering First Aid on the spot. The overall response actions taken by PRCS is appended below, whereas rescue / assessments are ongoing at the districts level:-

Date .13 Jan 2020.

 Collect basic information about the incident and coordinate with District authorities.
 Message has been sent to alert the staff and volunteers at district/provincial level for any possible deployment.
 Baluchistan branch coordinated with PDMA and while engaging volunteers in provision of first aid and helping stuck vehicles passengers.
 NHQ Coordination with branches, shared updates.

Date : 14 Jan 2020

 Coordination with DDMA Neelum and collection of secondary data.
 Coordination with Tehsil Administration, Tehsil Sharda, Dist Neelum. 
 NHQ coordinated with branches, transferred funds for Rapid need assessment.
 PRCS Baluchistan branch distributed NFI (500 Warm Jacket) from their own stock.
 NHQ NDRT team is on high alert for quick deployment.
 PRCS is in close coordination with all the stakeholders through PRCS Provincial / State and district chapters. PRCS staff and volunteers already on alert. In AJK district staff of CBRA&SB and First Aid is in coordination with District authorities and updating the situation on regular basis.

Date .15 Jan 2020

 PRCS Baluchistan branch is engaged with PDMA and distributed NFIs from the PHQ.(500 blanket)
 NHQ Team is in close coordination with branches and transferred funds for RNA in all 03 branches.
 PRCS NHQ has sent 100 packages along with health team to AJK.
 Teams have been mobilized and deployed for Rapid Need assessment.
 Coordination with UN OCHA regarding data sharing and responses of other actors.

16 Jan 2020

 Operations briefing meeting held at NHQ participated by TRC, IFRC, GRC, ICRC and NHQ managers chaired by JD Ops.
 Close coordination with RNA teams at branches, AJK teams are facing difficulties as most of the roads are still blocked. NDRT and sectoral leads are on standby if branches request.
 PRCS Baluchistan will be distributing some more NFIs today.

17 Jan 2020

 Baluchistan branch distributed more 200 blankets, 300 food packs in mutung and Kaan Metherzai
 Coordination with Branches on Rapid need Assessment.
 Coordination with UN agencies and attended HCT meeting by PRCS and IFRC on recent snowfall.

event_details.name: Heavy snowfall, rain and sliding  in Pakaistan (Baluchistan, Azad Kashmir  and KP  )

results.description: From 11th to 13th Jan, 2020 several parts of Pakistan faced heavy rains, heaviest snow fall, flash floods, avalanches and landslides. 105 persons have been reported as dead throughout Pakistan. Among them 20 reported dead in Baluchistan, 05 in KP, 2 in GB and 78 has been confirmed by State Disaster Management Authority in AJK. Roads are still blocked in many areas in AJK and Baluchistan and the situation will be cleared by later today. Assessment reports are still awaited from many areas and there is possibility that losses and damage figure will increase. The provincial government of Baluchistan has declared a state of emergency in 11 districts and requested NDMA via letter dated 13 January to allow humanitarian organizations to support PDMA to reach out the people in need. The situation in different areas is as follows:- A. Azad Jamu Kashmir (AJK) In Azad Jammu & Kashmir (AJK) the worst affected district is Neelum (Extreme North District of AJK) due to heavy snowfall, rain & avalanche resultantly cause 76 x dead with more than 91 x houses completely destroyed. Upper parts of Neelum are disconnected with DHQ Neelum. The rapid assessment has been conducted in Neelam district from 15th – 17th January 2020 with two assessment team from PRCS AJK with PRCS local volunteers. KEY FINDINGS, source, ( Revenue Dpt, District Administration, Health Dpt and DDMA)  ,The total population affected by the avalanches in District Neelum is 910 households (6,370 individuals) however, 3,134 households (21,938 individuals) were indirectly affected due to the heavy snow.  In total, 74 deaths and 53 injured are confirmed by the local authorities.  88 houses are completely damaged, while 94 houses are partially damaged (The people are living in joint family system and 5-6 families are residing in one multi stories house).  The affected families are living with the host families and there is no communal camps established yet.  Only 30% of the total affected families have access to functional sanitation facilities. B. Baluchistan The heaviest snowfall – two feet – was recorded by the Pakistan Meteorological Department (PMD) in Ziarat, while Quetta and Zhob each received more than a foot of snow. Quetta, Ziarat, Harnoi, Kan Mehtarzai, Muslim Bagh, Khanozai and Khojak Pass were blanketed in snow. Due to heavy snow fall the Highways, Quetta-Sibi, Quetta-Karachi and Quetta-Zhob are blocked. ii. In District Kharan, Panjgoor and Gwadar heavy rains are reported which result flash-flooding in different area of mentioned district. In total 56mm rainfall, was recorded in Turbat, 40mm in Pasni and 26 mm in Pishin. C. Gilgit Baltistan . Astor Valley has received a record-breaking snow in some areas breaking 100 years record (Media and GBDMA). In total 7 (5 army personal and 2 civilian) died due to avalanche while 4 got injured. The snow has paralyzed life in the region, with residents in northern valleys restricted to their homes. Gilgit Baltistan authorities mobilized all their resources to open the blocked roads and to assist the people in need. Since the region is cut off from the rest of the country, local hospitals are facing shortage of medicines. D. Khyber-Pakhtunkhwa (KP). KP is also in the grip of cold wave. Rain and snowfall continued in Hazara and Malakand divisions, Kohat, Orakzai and Chitral. All access roads to Chitral, including the Lowari Tunnel, are blocked while water and electricity supplies are also disrupted.
results.actions_others:
 Immediate Rescue Operations launched by SDMA/PDMA/GBDMA District Administration and Pakistan Army
 High alert has been sent to local officials and rescue teams in their respective regions where up to four feet of snowfall has been reported so far.
 A Special Emergency Desk has been set up in the State Disaster Management Authority to monitor the situation (AJK) and DDMA Neelum is functional and monitoring the situation at district level.
Pakistan Army:
 Started the rescue operation and transporting injured to hospital.
results.other_sources: PRCS Rapid assessment report,National disaster Management authority (NDMA),Local media & UN OCHA
results.summary: Sit rep 3,Heavy rain,heaviest snowfall,avalanches,flash flood &land slides ,(Baluchistan,AJK and KP)

actions_taken.summary:
The teams are preparing for at all level. Listed below is our preparedness for TC Tino.
Preparedness

-	Continues communication with Divisional Services Coordinator regarding the system
-	Branches - trained ERT volunteers has been informed and are on standby 
-	Community – trained CERT volunteers has been informed and are on standby
-	Staffs and Management informed
-	Stocks update from all branches
-	Contact details of possible Tropical Disturbance track is updated
-	EWEA – HQ and Branches is now following the disaster response chart colour coded system
-	Assessment forms available
-	Preparedness Messaging has been posted on social media 
-	Stakeholders/clusters contacts updated-HQ and Branch
-	DSLO preparedness meeting conducted with government and relevant stakeholders
-	Continues monitoring the situation using the Fiji Meteorological service media update and windyty.com
-	Ongoing contact with IFRC
- Continues update on the Social Media of our work and advice to public
Response Capacity
-	Stocks accommodated for 3,000HH’s (15,000pp) ready
-	10 ERT members on standby at branches
-	90 CERT volunteers on standby in communities
-	Trained staffs and Volunteers on PSS, PGI, FA on standby
Communities in one of the islands directly in the track of the cyclone has moved their elderly and disable persons to safe shelter, which is Fiji Red Cross office on the island (Vanuabalavu). This is done in partnership with the Police on the island.
Continues support provided from CCST Suva office regarding preparation and planning for possible response by Surge support, as well as media coverage by communication manager.

results.description: TC Tino has brought lot of rain with is now taking effect in the central division.  2 person are now missing when they tried to cross flooded river. Fiji is still expecting heavy rain in the next 24 to 48 hours which may bring about flooding of rivers, affecting low lying areas.
results.actions_others: restriction of movement has been placed on all Northern part of Fiji. This include school and business closer.  Advice issued to general public to avoid movement of people to low lying areas due to possible flash flooding.
results.other_sources: 2 evacuation centres open at Navua Town in the central division. These Evac Centre hold the 79 family members around that area.
results.summary: Catergory 1 Tropical Cyclone Tino

event_details.name: Heavy snowfall, rain and sliding  in Pakaistan (Baluchistan, Azad Kashmir  and KP  )

results.description: Heaviest snowfall  is recorded by the Pakistan Meteorological Department (PMD) in some part of Balochistan ,Azad jammu Kashmir, Gilgit Baltistan & Khyber Pukhtoonkhwa . In District Kharan, Panjgoor and Gwadar heavy rains are also reported which result flash-flooding in different area of mentioned districts. In Azad Jammu & Kashmir (AJK) the worst affected district is Neelum (Extreme North District of AJK) with more than 64 dead and several missing. The snow has paralyzed life in the region & the people in the area is restricted to their homes. Authorities says that the ongoing snowfall is the heaviest since April 1996. Since the affected districts is cut off from the rest of the country, local hospitals are facing shortage of medicines. Khyber-Pakhtunkhwa is also in the grip of cold wave. Rain and snowfall continued in Hazara and Malakand divisions, Kohat, Orakzai and Chitral. All access roads to Chitral, including the Lowari Tunnel, are blocked while water and electricity supplies are also disrupted.
results.actions_others:
SDMA/DDMA/District Administration/Health Department/Rescue 1122:
Response:
• Immediate Rescue Operations launched by SDMA/PDMA/GBDMA District Administration and Pakistan Army
• High alert has been sent to local officials and rescue teams in their respective regions where up to four feet of snowfall has been reported so far.
• A Special Emergency Desk has been set up in the State Disaster Management Authority to monitor the situation (AJK) and DDMA Neelum is functional and monitoring the situation at district level.
Pakistan Army:
• Started the rescue operation and transporting injured to hospital.
results.other_sources: The source for data is local government, RCRC local Volunteers & local Media
results.summary: Heavy snowfall, rain and sliding  in Pakaistan (Baluchistan, Azad Kashmir  and KP  )

What has been done?
Actions that were well executed

-	The initial response was excellent in that all role-players were immediately notified once the incident was reported in Local Municipalities where SARCS is active in the Free State and  Emergency Services, The MEC of Cogta, The Mayor and Social Development.

-	The incident command center (JOC)was well experienced and decisions taken were immediately executed
-	South African Red Cross Society was part of daily management meeting 
-	Many SARCS volunteers assisted and would spend long hours assisting with data collection, delivery of food items to the affected households, rebuilding of shacks, packing donations and sorting clothing and other donated items.
results.other_sources:
On the 10 January 2020 around 19h00 Free State experienced flooding on a scale the Province (Bloemfontein) has not seen in many years. The rains which started on the 11th Jan 2020 left a massive trail of destruction never experienced before, 4 people lost their lives and over 346 more homeless. This unusual weather pattern is caused by the La Nino effect, and the resulting floods have caused unprecedented disruption of services, displacement of people, loss of livelihoods and even worse, loss of life. SARCS (Free State Office) received a report from a call from Mangaung Metro Municipality (Directorate of Social Development/Disaster Management).

On the 11th January 2020 the Area in question were subsequently visited by the SARCS volunteers and staff and other stakeholders to conduct on-site damage assessment where the investigations, observation and interviews as correct methodologies were applied to unearth evidence for arriving at informed findings. After such investigation (Assessment) the following were however registered as findings:

1.	The affected families are destitute and unemployed. Currently Accommodated at Paradise hall. (36 Household). They mostly lost not only the shacks they occupied but also their entire belongings such Furniture’s and Clothing.
2.	Others got injured by corrugated irons  as their shacks we Blown away by the storm and were fortunately attended to by hospitals. 
3.	Most of Families their yards were still water logged during our assessment which poses threat to the house foundation as the areas it’s a Flood line area.
4.	26 Causalities where attended to at Pelonomi Hospital due to Fractures (All admitted)
5.	4 Fatalities were reported (46 years old Female, 39 Years old Mothe leaving a 4 month old baby, a gentlemen in his late 30s all residing in Ward 12)
6.	426 Households were assessed in Caleb Motshabi, 26 in Bergman Sqr, 16 Khayelisha, 32 Phase9 and 16 Phase7. Total households affected 516.
results.summary: Floods in Mangaung Free State

results.description:
After a brief waning of activity following lava fountaining at 2:49-4:28 AM today, Taal’s eruption resumed immediately with weak sporadic lava fountaining and hydrovolcanic activity at the Main Crater that generated steam-laden plumes approximately 2km tall. New lateral vents were observed to have opened up on the northern flank where short 500m lava fountains emanate.
Since the last update, heavy ashfall from the ongoing eruptions of Taal has reportedly fallen southwest of the volcano island in Cuenca, Lemery, and Taal, Batangas. 
Fine ashfall can cause irritation and breathing problems especially among the elderly and children. Long-term exposure may be harmful to respiratory health. In addition, areas of ashfall have also experienced sulfurous smell which can also cause irritation. Affected populations are advised to avoid inhalation of ash and use N95-grade facemasks or wet cloth or towel when going outdoors. Motorists are advised to drive with extreme caution as ash can cause poor visibility and, when wet, can make roads slippery.
The Philippine Seismic Network has recorded a total of one hundred forty-four (144) volcanic earthquakes in the Taal region since 1:00 PM, January 12, 2020. Forty-four (44) of these earthquakes were felt with intensities ranging from Intensity I – V in Tagaytay City; Alitagtag, Lemery, Santo Tomas, and Talisay, Batangas. Such intense seismic activity probably signifies continuous magma intrusion beneath the Taal edifice, which may lead to further eruptive activity.
DOST-PHIVOLCS strongly reiterates that total evacuation of the Volcano Island and high-risk areas within the 14-kilometer radius from the Taal Main Crater must be enforced. Population in areas in the southwest are advised to guard against the effects of heavy and prolonged ashfall. Civil aviation authorities must advise aircraft to avoid airspace around Taal Volcano as airborne ash and ballistic fragments from the eruption column pose hazards to aircraft. DOST-PHIVOLCS is continually monitoring the eruption and will update all stakeholders of further developments.

A total of 5,458 families or 24,508 persons are taking temporary shelters in 75 evacuation centers. The following LGUs hosted IDPs from affected municipalities.

Heavy ash falls still experienced in areas near the volcano including the northwest areas (part of Tagaytay, Silang, Calamba, Sto. Tomas, Alabang, NCR, Antipolo) due to wind direction. Zero visibility reported in the areas within 8kms danger zone. About 3 inches thick of ashes was observed in the roads of the affected areas mainly the Municipalities of Agoncillo, San Nicolas, Laurel, Talisay and Lemery. Foul odors associated with the smell of sulfur are reported.

results.description: Raising the alert status of Taal from Alert Level 3 (magmatic unrest) to Alert Level 4 (hazardous eruption imminent). As of 5:30 PM PST (1730H), eruptive activity at Taal Volcano Main Crater intensified as continuous eruption generated a tall 10-15 kilometer steam-laden tephra column with frequent volcanic lightning that rained wet ashfall on the general north as far as Quezon City. Volcanic tremor was recorded continuously since 11:00 AM and two volcanic earthquakes of magnitudes M2.5 and M3.9 were felt at Intensity III in Tagaytay City and Alitagtag, Batangas were recorded at 6:15 and 6:22 PM PST, respectively. In view of the above, DOST-PHIVOLCS is now raising the alert status of Taal from Alert Level 3 to Alert Level 4. This means that hazardous explosive eruption is possible within hours to days. DOST-PHIVOLCS strongly reiterates total evacuation of Taal Volcano Island and additional evacuation of areas at high risk to pyroclastic density currents and volcanic tsunami within a 14-kilometer radius from Taal Main Crater. Areas in the general north of Taal Volcano are advised to guard against the effects of heavy and prolonged ashfall. Civil aviation authorities must advise aircraft to avoid the airspace around Taal Volcano as airborne ash and ballistic fragments from the eruption column pose hazards to aircraft. DOST-PHIVOLCS is continually monitoring the eruption and will update all stakeholders of further developments.

event_details.name: Within 72 hours (10-12 January) flash flood hit Sistan and Bluchistan province, Iran

results.description: Within 72 hours (10-12 January) flash flood hit Sistan and Bluchistan province, located in southern east of Iran (this province has a coastal border with Oman sea). According to the provincial branch, 13 districts (Iranshahr, Chabahar, Khash, Delgan, Zahedan, Sarbaz, Saravan, Sib and Sooran, fotooh, Kenarak, Mirjaveh, Nikshar and Hirmand) have been affected by flood and Iranian Red Crescent Society have rendering relief services for 1,248 persons and one person has been reported as missing and 327 persons have been sheltered. According to the director manager of the provincial branch four pregnant women trapped by flood were transported to medical centers. Inhabitants of 6 villages are also evacuated and sheltered as the result of heavy rainfall.

results.description: Following severe rain fall during the week of January 1st, as of today another weather front is affecting Israel. As of 1900 (Israeli time), the front has affected throughout the day mainly the north of Israel (Haifa area), and is expected to go South during the night, affecting the center of Israel. In the it is snowing in upper Gallile, roads and homes were flooded in Naharia, Acre and Haifa. The city of Ashdod (in the South of Israel) is suffering during the last hours from a power outage. Heavy raining is expected during the night and through tomorrow in the center (Tel Aviv area) with very high risk of flooding (due to the saturation of the soil from last week's rainfall).

event_details.name: On 8 January 2020, aircraft belonging to Ukraine, with 179 passengers crashed in Iran - Tehran

results.description: On 8 January 2020, a 737 Boeing aircraft belonging to Ukraine, with 179 passengers (147 Iranian and 32 of other nationalities: Canada, 6 passengers, Sweden, 4 passengers, Ukraine, 11 passengers, Afghanistan, 10 passengers and Britain, 1 passenger) and 9 crew members, crashed in Robat Karim city in Tehran province. The aircraft was flying from Imam Khomeini International Airport to Kyiv crashed at 06:18 (local time). According to the local witnesses and assessment made in the site the plane crash had no survival because of the explosion of the aircraft. The names of the foreign passengers are available at the request.
