event_details.name: Central Africa Republic -Bangui, Bimbo, Bambari, Bouca, Kouango: Floods 10/2019

results.description:
La République Centrafricaine selon les prévisions météorologiques enregistrées connait depuis quelques semaines des pics de pluviométrie entrainant des pluies diluviennes qui ont eu pour conséquence des inondations dans plusieurs villes.
Dans la nuit du 20 au 21 Octobre 2019 de 4h à 9 heures, une pluie diluvienne s’est abattue dans l’étendue du territoire créant ainsi des inondations dans le 6ème Arrondissement de Bangui, la Commune de Bimbo, sortie Sud située à 9 km de la ville de Bangui et principalement 3 autres villes où la sécurité est déjà précaire due aux incidents sécuritaires qui y sévissent à savoir : Au Sud, Kouango à 419 km; à l’Ouest, Bambari à 385 km et au Nord, Bouca à 289 km de Bangui.
Au 6ème Arrondissement de Bangui ; la population vit particulièrement une inondation due à un débordement du fleuve Oubangui qui continue d’absorber les concessions.
Les éléments ci-dessous récapitule les dégâts matériels observés dans ces villes :
Dégâts matériels

Lieu	   Maisons complètement détruites	Maisons partiellement détruites	Puits inondés	Latrines inondés
6ème	   197	                                                                           308	                                       298	                    306
Bimbo	   88	                                                                                     92	                                          18	                     180
Bambari   197	                                                                             60	                                        201	                     257
Kouango  105	                                                                             92	                                         77	                     107
Bouca	   186	                                                                             65	                                        117	                     201
TOTAL	   773	                                                                            617	                                        711	                    1051

Les données ci-dessous résume le nombre des personnes touchées dans ces villes :
Sinistrés

Lieu	   Chef de famille	Personnes à charge	Hommes	Femmes	Enfants	Femmes enceintes	Handicapés
6ème	505	                                  3276	            702	           1069	           1367	              102	                        36
Bimbo	 180                                  900	                     180	             215	            449	               56	                          0
Bambari 257	                                  1285	             180	             212	            835	               45	                         13
Kouango 197	                                   905	             105	            237	            473	               63	                        27
Bouca	   251	                          1255	             145	            317	            665	               93	                        35
TOTAL	 1390	                          7621	             1312	        2050	           3789	             359	                        111

Tous ces chiffres sont provisoires car il continue de pleuvoir et les maisons continuent de s’écrouler. Les familles touchées sont relogées dans les familles d’accueil, d’autre dorment en plein air, compte tenu de la rentrée des classes ; les familles sinistrées ne peuvent pas se rendre dans les écoles.
Les Comités locaux ont mobilisés entre 20 à 30 volontaires pour l’évaluation de la situation. Particulièrement au Comité Local du 6ème Arrondissement de Bangui, le Ministre de l’Urbanisme et de l’Habitat, le Député, le Maire, les Chefs de quartiers et le Président National de la CRCA ont fait une descente sur le terrain pour évaluer les dégâts.
Le Maire de la Commune de Bimbo a octroyé un site pour le relogement provisoire des sinistrés.
Dans les villes de Bambari ; Bouca et Kouango les autorités locales ont appelé à l’aide par les voies des ondes radiophoniques.
L’ONG ACTED pour le 6ème Arrondissement ; HCR pour Bimbo étaient sur le terrain.
En ce moment ; le marché MPOKO-BAC, l’un des plus grands marché de ravitaillement pour la population de Bangui (frontière avec la République Démocratique du Congo) est partiellement fermée car inondée.
Les points d’eau et les latrines sont inondés. Ainsi la construction des abris provisoires est envisageable pour un relogement des sinistrés.   
Le service météorologique du Ministère des Transports et de l’Aviation Civile précise que le retard des pluies enregistrés au Nord, Est, Sud et Bangui engendrera un taux de pluviométrie au-dessus de la moyenne jusqu’au mois de Décembre, ceci explique les inondations enregistrées dans ces zones.
Les populations sinistrées de ces zones déjà touchées par le conflit sont doublement atteintes en ce moment. Une action humanitaire urgente devrait être envisagée pour alléger les souffrances physiques et morales de celles-ci, compte tenu du nombre d’enfants, d’handicapés et de femmes enceintes atteintes par ce sinistre.
 Notons que la plus part de ces zones sont situées sur la ceinture du fleuve Oubangui dont le débit continue d’augmenter à cause des pluies qui ne sont pas prêtes de se terminer.
Ces personnes sinistrées ont besoin des abris provisoires et d'une assistance en produits de première nécessité (moustiquaires, eau potable, savons, couvertures…)

Le Maire de la Commune de Bimbo a octroyé un site pour le relogement provisoire des sinistrés.

actions_taken.summary: Ghana Red Cross Society with the support of Swiss Red Cross(SRC) immediately activated its Community Disaster Response Teams (CDPRTs) to provide psychosocial, carry out rapid assessment and mounted family tents for families in Kassena Nankan and Bulsa North Districts. GRCS also distributed foldable jerry cans to 20 families living in the Area Council building in Manyoro in the Kassena Nankana Municipal. The emergency Reponse team also provided first aid to 8 injured victims at the shelter.
Swiss Red Cross supported the National Society with rapid joint assessment and provided tents for shelter.
Provided technical support to the National Society in terms of coordination and resource mobilization.

event_details.name: Ghana, Upper East Regional Floods Emergency

results.description:
In the Upper East Region, the torrential rains between 6th and 12th October caused serious flooding and damaged to houses and farmlands leading to displacement of people and fatalities. After assessment, it was declared emergency by the Government on 15th October 2019.  The joint rapid assessment by National Disaster Management Organization (NADMO) and Ghana Red Cross Society reported that a total of 26,083 people were affected one way or the other in the Region, out of which 10,890 are children, 19 people were reported dead across the region. There were 133 displaced people from their homes and took shelter in Manyoro area Council. A total of 116 communities from 13 districts were negatively affected by the floods. Over 2,218 houses were total destroyed with 3,743 others partially destroyed with occupants displaced and sheltered in nearby schools, Churches, Area council and with Relatives. 
These also indicated immediate need for Water, food and NFIs including temporary shelter, beddings (blankets, matresses & mats), kitchen sets, water collection and treatment tablets among others
results.actions_others: The National Disaster Management Organization (NADMO) carried a joint rapid assessment and also provided coordination in the management of flood disaster.
results.summary: Ghana, Upper East Regional Floods Emergency

actions_taken.summary:
Auxiliaire des pouvoirs publics dans le domaine humanitaire et membre des différentes plateformes (nationale, départementale et locale) de réduction des risques de catastrophes et d’adaptation aux changements climatiques, la Croix-Rouge Béninoise s’est très tôt positionnée aux côtés des autorités à divers niveaux pour la mise en place de dispositifs de prise en charge des sinistrés.  Ainsi une évaluation rapide a été organisée par le bureau des comités locaux des communes touchées. Une mission de la direction des secours et catastrophes a aussi été effectuée afin de mieux évaluer les dégâts et les besoins pour une meilleure planification des actions de réponse. 
De même, les volontaires des comités locaux concernés ont été organisés afin de mener des séances de sensibilisation en matière de promotion d’hygiène et d’assainissement et d’aider les autorités pour la préparation des sites de relogement des sinistrés. Les réunions de commandement sont organisées à divers niveau territorial où la SN est activement représentée.

L’Agence Nationale de Protection Civile (ANPC) en collaboration avec les autorités municipales ont identifié des sites de relogement des personnes touchées s’organise activement à cet effet.
A Athiémè et Lokossa, Caritas Bénin se mobilise pour assister les sinistrés. Mais pour le moment, rien n’est encore défini. 
Dans la commune de Dogbo, les autorités locales ont mis en place une équipe composée d’Organisations Non Gouvernementales (Plan International Bénin, PIAPS), le comité local Croix-Rouge de la commune et des responsables techniques de la mairie pour une évaluation rapide des dégâts et de procéder à l’évacuation des sinistrés.

contacts.name: Bernard ALOTOWANOU
contacts.title: Directeur National des Secours et Catastrophes

results.description: Le Samedi 12 Octobre 2019, les communes situées sur les côtes du fleuve Mono dans la partie Sud-ouest du Bénin ont connu un pic du débordement du fleuve suite aux pluies diluviennes qui se sont intensifiées ces deux dernières semaines dans le pays et aux lâchées d’eau au niveau du barrage de Nagbéto. Cette situation a occasionné une grande inondation dans les communes d’Athiémè, de Lokossa, de Grand-Popo (département du Mono) et de Dogbo (département du Couffo) dont plusieurs localités sont actuellement sous l’eau. Ce weekend, les pluies se sont intensifiées, créant une situation exponentielle de danger qui a occasionné un (1) mort et a placé  la zone en alerte rouge. Le gouvernement du Bénin, à travers l’Agence Nationale de la Protection Civile (ANPC) a diligenté une évaluation rapide de la situation où il est dénombré plusieurs dégâts matériels, l’effondrement de plus de 690 habitations, la destruction de 4903 hectares de cultures et la perte de 52170 cheptel.
results.actions_others: Une délégation gouvernementale composée des ministres en charge de la Santé et des Affaires sociales s’est dépêchée sur le terrain pour un soutien psychosocial et matériel aux sinistrés et un don de vivres et des articles ménagers essentiels. Les autorités départementales (les préfets) et les maires des communes touchées ont organisé des descentes sur le terrain afin d'apprécier la situation. Certains bureaux d'arrondissement et lieux  publics sont identifiés pour accueillir les sinistrés déplacés qui se comptent par millier.
results.summary: Benin - West-Coast - Flood 12/2019

actions_taken.summary:
KRCS has also carried out assessments in areas affected by floods to determine the extent of effects and identify priority needs for affected communities. Following the assessments, KRCS has been undertaking a number of actions to support communities affected by floods. Key actions taken so far include, leading search and rescue efforts, distribution of Shelter NFIs to affected communities in Wajir, and Marsabit counties utilizing existing stocks that had been pre-positioned in different parts of the country, hygiene promotion activities currently ongoing in Kilifi, Wajir, Marsabit and Kisumu Counties on Cholera and other waterborne diseases and roll out of cash assistance to 150HHs in Moyale, Marsabit County

In addition, KRCS has developed and disseminated early warning messages to communities in flood and landslide prone areas. The messages were translated to Kiswahili for parts of the country where Kiswahili is widely spoken to ensure enhanced understanding by communities in those areas. 

More recently as the rains have intensified this has resulted in more severe flooding and in some locations flash flooding which has been beyond the annual reoccurring flooding. This has impacted the areas of Nairobi, Kwale Counties, Taita Taveta and Turkana counties and the needs have escalated above what the National Society (NS) can absorb with its own resources or capacities.

results.description:
Heavy rainfall has been experienced in many parts of the country since onset of the October – November – December 2019 rains season. This has resulted in flooding especially in the Northern parts of country which have seen highly enhanced rainfall since the start of October 2019.  The heavy rains are a result of positive Indian Ocean Dipole (IOD) which has been warmer than normal, which often results in above average rainfall in the Eastern Africa region. 

As at 12th October 2019, the observed dipole index was +2.15°C, this is higher than was observed in 1961. During OND 1961, the highest observed dipole index was +0.8°C and above normal rainfall was observed over much of the Country. For example, the rainfall observed in November 1961 (blue bars) was above what is normally received (Orange bars) during the month in all stations.  With the warming currently being observed over the Indian Ocean and the magnitude of the IOD, the Country may experience rainfall that is heavier than was observed in 1961.
The intensity of the heavy rains has increased over the last few days and is expected to continue over the next few days according to the latest heavy rains alert from the Kenya Meteorological Department (KMD) covering the period from 16th October, 2019 to 20th October, 2019, which indicates that heavy rainfall is likely to be experienced in North East, South East, the Coastal Regions of Kenya, Western and Central regions including Nairobi Area.

The Northern parts of the country have been the most affected with displacement of populations, damage to infrastructure, and disruption of livelihoods. In parts of the Rift valley, West Kenya and Central highlands, heavy rains have also been experienced with varying levels of impacts reported.
Landslides have also been experienced in Elgeyo Marakwet and Meru counties. In Elgeyo Marakwet counties, a family of 4 lost their lives after their house was swept by a landslide in Turung village, Marakwet East. The landslide was caused by heavy rains that has hit the area the last few days. 
In Meru County, a landslide was reported in Miritini area which resulted in damage to houses and farms but no injuries or deaths were reported. 

As at the time of this DREF, a total of 14,078HHs (approx. 84,367 people) have been affected, 21 fatalities, 2 injured. The number of displaced households is currently estimated at 6,000HHs. In addition, 531 acres of land with crops have been destroyed and 21,675 livestock have been washed away. 
Counties affected so far include, Marsabit, Wajir, Mandera, Turkana, Elgeyo Marakwet, Kitui, Meru, Kajiado, Kwale, Nandi, Mombasa, Murang’a and Busia.
results.actions_others: A planning meeting has been undertaken by the ministry of interior to develop priority actions for response. The government has also been leading search and rescue and evacuation of populations at risk as well dissemination of early warning messages through the national and county government structures
results.summary: Kenya Floods Situation Update

event_details.name: Dam collapse death toll in Krasnoyarsk region

results.description: A dam at a technological reservoir of a gold mining artel collapsed early on Saturday near the settlement of Schetinkino in the Krasnoyarsk region. Two temporary dormitories were flooded. The Russian Emergencies Ministry sent rescuers from neighboring regions to the site of the incident to assist in disaster relief efforts. According to updated data, 15 dead and 13 missing. 14 people were injured, three of them in serious condition.The mudflow wave due to the dam breaking reached a height of about 4 m. The miners' village is located in the taiga, because of the distance from the settlements there are communication problems. The nearest town, Artemovsk, is 60 km from the working village.
results.summary: Dam collapse death toll in Krasnoyarsk region

actions_taken.summary:
Cruz Roja Guatemalteca mantiene el monitoreo de la situación registrada a nivel nacional y las 20 Delegaciones se mantienen activas y en coordinación con sus autoridades locales para atender las necesidades de la población. El Centro de Operaciones de Emergencia registra las actividades y la situación de las Delegaciones de CRG. 
Voluntarios de CRG de las Delegaciones de Retalhuleu y Mazatenango se encuentran realizando evaluaciones de daños en sus localidades y apoyando las labores de distribución de ayuda humanitaria. La Delegación de Cobán ha activado sus procedimientos de búsqueda de una persona desaparecida, aparentemente arrastrada por una crecida de río. 
Las Delegaciones de Coatepeque, Tecún Umán, El Palmar, Petén, Quiché y Quetzaltenango reportan lluvias intensas en sus localidades.
En las redes sociales de CRG se publican las recomendaciones a la población para reducir riesgos ante la presencia de las lluvias y los efectos colaterales.

results.description:
El sistema de baja presión se ha fortalecido en depresión tropical No. 17, la cual ha generado lluvias y nublados en el territorio guatemalteco, lo cual ha aumentado caudales de ríos y el registro de lluvias indica que ha sido mayor en las zonas del Puerto de San José, costa de Jutiapa, costa de San Marcos, Retalhuleu, Quetzaltenango, Ciudad Capital y Cobán. El oleaje del Pacífico se ha incrementado, con vientos de entre 30 a 50 Km/h. Esta depresión podría convertirse en tormenta tropical, en las próximas 24 horas.
El Instituto de Sismología, Vulcanología, Meteorología e Hidrología - Insivumeh, ha indicado que el "ambiente húmedo e inestable debido a que sobre las costa del Pacífico se encuentra la zona de convergencia intertropical (Vaguada Monzónica para nuestra región). Este sistema favorece a que se estén presentando lluvias de carácter intermitente en la región central y occidental, así como lluvias fuertes en las regiones del Pacífico. Estas condiciones prevalecerán al menos 18 horas."

Las lluvias han ocasionado deslizamientos en diferentes puntos del país, especialmente en el Occidente, así como inundaciones y desbordamientos de ríos. También se reportan viviendas inundadas en Suchitepéquez y Retalhuleu.
results.actions_others:
En las últimas horas, las autoridades han emitido los avisos 36, 37, 38 y 39 para alertar a los gobiernos municipales y departamentales, así como a la población, de los posibles efectos de esta situación, así como alentar a que se tomen las medidas de precaución necesarias para prevenir riesgos.

La alerta departamental anaranjada se ha declarado en Escuintla, la amarilla en 13 departamentos del país, así como en 15 municipios más. La alerta institucional a nivel nacional es amarilla. Las autoridades de educación han emitido un comunicado en el que instan a que los directores departamentales de educación suspendan las clases según la situación local. 
El Ministerio de Comunicaciones realiza la limpieza de las carreteras que han sido obstruidas por deslizamientos de tierra, desprendimientos de roca o caídas de árboles.
Se han habilitado 2 albergues en los municipios de Guatemala y San Antonio, Suchitepéquez, para atender a 47 personas.
results.summary: Depresión Tropical 17E

results.description:
A magnitude-6.3 earthquake hit North Cotabato on Wednesday, October 16, the Phivolcs reported. The earthquake, which is tectonic in origin, struck Makilala, Cotabato, at around 7:37 pm at a depth of 2 kilometers.

The earthquake was felt in the following areas:
Intensity VII - Tulunan, North Cotabato, M'Lang, North Cotabato, Kidapawan City
Intensity VI - Tacurong City
Intensity V - Kalamansig, Lebak and Palimbang, Sultan Kudarat;
Pikit and Pres. Roxas, North Cotabato
Intensity IV - Cotabato City; Sultan Kudarat, Matanog and Barira, Maguindanao
Intensity I - Zamboanga City

Instrumental Intensities:

Intensity VII - Kidapawan City
Intensity V - Tupi and Polomolok, South Cotabato; Alabel, Sarangani
Intensity IV - Kiamba, Sarangani; T'Boli, South Cotabato; General Santos City
Intensity III - Cagayan de Oro City; Gingoog City, Misamis Oriental;
Intensity II - Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental
Intensity I - Dipolog City; Bislig City

Aftershocks are expected and as of reporting time, more than 20 aftershocks were recorded in areas of North Cotabato and Sultan Kudarat.
results.actions_others:
Government Actions Taken:

- Phivolcs disseminated earthquake information 
-NDRRMC released advisory re: earthquake. Alerted all LGU to alert offices and agencies to respond to the impact of the earthquake and advise to disseminate information to communities.
results.summary: Magnitude 6.3 Earthquake in North Cotabato

results.description: On 16 October 2019, a 6.4 magnitude earthquake (initially measured at 6.7 magnitude) struck Mindanao in the Philippines (19:37 local time). The quake struck approximately 7.7km from the city of Columbio at a depth of 14.12km. Tremors have been reported in neighbouring provinces, Davao City and Grand Santos. There are 7.9m people living within a 100km radius of the epicenter of the earthquake (GDACS).  The Pacific Tsunami Warning Center has not issued any tsunami alert.
results.summary: Philippines - M6.4 earthquake in Mindanao

actions_taken.summary:
La Croix-Rouge de Côte d’Ivoire a déployé ses volontaires à travers son mécanisme d'intervention. 
- Évaluation rapide des besoins
Sur le terrain, dans les différentes zones inondées, des volontaires ont procédé à une évaluation rapide des besoins. Cette évaluation a permis de dénombrer le nombre de victimes, les dégâts matériels et les pertes de denrées alimentaires et non alimentaires.
- Assistance aux victimes
En réponse à la détresse des victimes, le CRCI, par l'intermédiaire de ses bénévoles, fournit une assistance aux victimes pour la réinstallation des ménages dans des zones plus sûres. En outre, il sensibilise la population afin de fournir les premiers secours aux blessés et un soutien psychosocial aux familles des défunts.
Mais ces actions restent insuffisantes au regard des besoins de la communauté.
- Coordination des opérations
En réponse à cette situation, le PCO de la CRCI a été mis sur pied à l'administration centrale. En outre, la CRCI participe à des réunions de coordination
Ainsi, sur le terrain, les volontaires ont procédé à une évaluation rapide des besoins dans les différentes zones touchées. Cette action d'évaluation s'est accompagnée d'actions de secours aux populations touchées en collaboration avec les autorités locales. Dans certains endroits, des bénévoles ont dû fournir une assistance psychosociale aux victimes des inondations et aux familles des défunts.
Les volontaires ont également aidé à reloger les ménages touchés.
Au niveau central, un BCP a été créé et participe aux réunions de coordination avec le gouvernement.
La CRCI a certainement la capacité technique et les ressources humaines nécessaires et formées pour aider les collectivités à faire face à cette situation d'inondation. En effet, la CRCI avait eu l'année précédente à travailler sur une telle opération d'urgence et dispose donc d'un mécanisme de réponse. 
Toutefois, il ne dispose pas de ressources financières suffisantes pour répondre aux besoins des populations touchées.

countries_details.society_name: Red Cross Society of Côte d'Ivoire
countries_details.name: Côte d'Ivoire

results.description:
La saison des pluies a démarrée en Côte d’Ivoire avec de fortes précipitations par endroit du pays entraînant des inondations. Ainsi le Week-end du vendredi 11 au Dimanche 13 a été marqué par des inondations entraînant d’importants dégâts matériels et des pertes en vie humaine.
Ce sont au total 05 villes (Abidjan, Aboisso, Ayamé, Grand Bassam et Man). A Ayamé par exemple, la rivière a débordée de ses rives inondant tous les quartiers commerciaux et Ākobo.
Suite à cette catastrophe 2 150 ménages ont été touchés par ces inondations dont 202 maisons entièrement inondées par les eaux, 11 maisons détruites, 32 personnes blessées, et 11 décès par noyade ou écrasement suite à l’éboulement des maisons. Ce sont donc au total 12 900 personnes touchés par la catastrophe perdant ainsi leurs produits de premières nécessités, leurs biens alimentaires, et non alimentaire. Plus de 512 personnes sont également sans abris et relocalisées dans des familles d’accueil.
Face à cette situation, le service de la protection a convoqué en urgence les différents acteurs dont la Croix Rouge afin d’assurer la coordination des opérations le Dimanche 13 Octobre 2019. Le plan de réponse est donc activé.
Il faut noter que cette période correspond à la saison des pluies (Septembre – Novembre) et selon le service de météorologique SODEXAM, de fortes précipitations sont annoncées dans les jours à venir à compter du Mercredi 14 Octobre 2019.
results.actions_others:
Jusqu'à ce jour le gouvernement à travers son Ministère de la Solidarité a fait les dons suivants : 
- Dons alimentaires et non alimentaires à la Mairie de Grand Bassam
- La Brigade militaire des sapeurs-pompiers (GSPM) est actuellement sur le terrain pour assurer l'évacuation des personnes envahies par les eaux de pluie.
Au total, toutes les structures approchées n'ont pas encore planifié une action pour le moment.
results.summary: Côte d'Ivoire, Inondations 11 au 12 Octobre 2019

actions_taken.summary: Japanese Red Cross Society has closely collaborated with the local DM authorities and made assessments and relief actions in 7 Prefectures where the typhoon hit severely. Although the rainfall is over, there are still some places where our assessment teams haven’t reach yet due to the landslides in mountainous areas. The JRCS Headquarter and its chapters have worked around the clock for the affected people.
In response to the request from the Japanese Red Cross Society, the IFRC deployed a Communication Manager to Japan to assist the international media relations and the Movement communication.

results.description:
Typhoon Hagibis, the most powerful typhoon throughout 2019 in this country, hit wide areas of eastern Japan including Tokyo on 12th and 13th October 2019. According to the Japan Meteorological Agency, the typhoon was classified as “very strong”, which is the highest category on Japan’s typhoon scale. It’s equivalent of a Category 5 hurricane. Its central pressure was 905 hPa at lowest, and the maximum wind gust speed was 80 m/s.
Hagibis brought violent winds and sustained heavy rain to the wide areas. For Tokai, Kanto, and Tohoku areas, the total rainfall in 72 hours was up to 750-1,000mm. This extraordinary rainfalls in such a short time resulted in rapid increase of river water then many floods eventually. According to the national media, 12 embankments in 10 major rivers collapsed and 77 rivers overflowed. Those floods made significant impacts on the affected areas, remaining many people stranded in water. Those people were evacuated by the rescue helicopters and boats deployed by the Fire Department and the Self Defense Force.
Public transportation services such as trains, airlines were almost suspended during the typhoon, and some transportation facilities were heavily damaged by floods.
results.summary: Japan -Typhoon Hagibis #1

event_details.name: Efectos de las Lluvias en Guatemala

results.description:
La temporada de lluvias en el territorio guatemalteco ha provocado daños en varias regiones urbanas y rurales del país. Inundaciones, desborde de ríos y deslizamientos son los eventos que se han suscitado, ante lo cual la población más afectada ha evacuado sus viviendas. El pronóstico del ente meteorológico indica que las lluvias continuarán en los próximos días, por lo que la población y autoridades deben estar alertas.
En la ciudad de Guatemala se registraron incidentes en diversos puntos, especialmente por la saturación de drenajes y la escorrentía de las lluvias. 
Los niveles de los ríos en el Suroccidente del país están en alerta, ya que superan los parámetros regulares.
results.actions_others: Las autoridades Departamentales y Municipales mantienen la alerta respectiva para atender a la población. La Conred brinda atención a las personas afectadas.
results.summary: Efectos de las Lluvias en Guatemala

results.description:
Les Départements du Mayo  Danay et du Logone et chari dans la région de l'Extrême-Nord Cameroun font face à des pluies dilluviennes depuis le mois de Septembre.  Avec la montée des eaux du fleuve logone, ceci a progressivement occasionné des inondations depuis le debut du mois d'octobre. On enregistre dans le département du Mayo Danay respectivement 521 personnes sinistrées pour l'arrondissement de Maga , 16215 personnes pour l'arrondissement de Kai-kai.  Dans le département de Logone et Chari plus précisement dans l'arrondissement de Zina, on  compte 19359 personnes.  Il faut noter que les informations du département de Maga proviennent de la branche locale et les informations pour les départements de kai-kai et de Zina, ont été communiquées après une évaluation faite sur le terrain par  une ONG locale APA (Action for Peace and Development).  On note les destructions de maisons avec perte des biens matériels  ainsi  que des cultures et du petit bétail.  La plupart de ces familles sinistrées dorment désormais à la belle étoile   sur la berge de la digue du fleuve logone (partie moins affectée).
A cela s'ajoute l'épidémie de choléra qui sévit depuis dans la région de l'Extrême-Nord et plus particulièrement dans les départements du Diamaré (district de santé de Maroua 1 et 2),  Mayo kani ( districts de santé de Moutourewa et Kaélé) et Mayo Danay (district de santé de Karhay).  La situation devient de plus en plus compliquée car des puits à ciel ouvert ont été pour la plupart engloutis par les eaux sales. Les besoins prioritaires sont dans le domaine du shelter/HHI, Wash, appui en article alimentaire, fournitures scolaires pour les enfants scolarisés.
results.actions_others:
l'ONG APA (Action for Peace and Development) a mené une évaluation dans  les arrondissements  de Zina ( département de Logone et Chari) et de Kai-kai  (département de Mayo Danay).
l'ONG  PULCI  (Programme d’Urgence de Lutte Contre les Inondations)  a mis à disposition de quelques sinistrés  30 tentes pour le recasement .
results.summary: Cameroon -  Extrême Nord  : Floods 10/2019

event_details.name: Iraq: Red Crescent deploys paramedics to assist injured people in Baghdad and other cities

results.description: More than 200 volunteers and paramedics from Iraq Red Crescent have been deployed today to assist people injured during demonstrations in Baghdad and other cities, mainly in Iraq’s south. Dozens of people have been injured during demonstrations in Baghdad that began on Tuesday and spread to other cities such as Basrah, Amara, Al Nasiriya, Al Diwaniya, Samawa, Babel and Najaf. The paramedics are providing first aid, transporting injured people to hospitals, and supporting medical teams inside the hospitals.
results.summary: Iraq: Red Crescent deploys paramedics to assist injured people in Baghdad and other cities 4/10/2019

results.description:
CONTEXTO:Durante el día de hoy, se ha incrementado la tensión política en el Perú entre el Congreso de la República del Perú y el Poder Ejecutivo producto de las elecciones de las nuevas autoridades del Tribunal Constitucional, adicionalmente  a otros incidentes relacionado con temas legislativos y procesos de investigación.
El Presidente de la República ha disuelto el Congreso de la República, el presidente del Consejo de Ministro ha sido cambiado.
Ante esta situación por su parte el Congreso de la República decidió suspender al Presidente de la República, juramentando a la Vicepresidenta en el cargo.
Varias manifestaciones se han realizado en las principales ciudad de los departamentos  del Perú apoyando la disolución del congreso. Al cierre del informe se ha concentrado la población frente al Congreso de la República manifestando el retiro de los congresistas del Congreso, presentando algunos incidentes de violencia.
La Policía viene brindando las condiciones de seguridad en el centro histórico y perímetro del Congreso de la República.
Actualmente no se ha presenciado movilización de las Fuerzas Armadas.
Por le momento no hay presencia de heridos o personas privadas de la libertad.

results.description: On 19 September 2019, the Department of Health (DOH) confirmed the re-emergence of polio in the Philippines and declared a national polio outbreak . This follows a confirmed Vaccine Derived Poliovirus Type 2 (VPDV2) case in a three-year old child in Lanao de Sur (Mindanao). Subsequently, another case of polio (strain to be confirmed) was reported on 20 September, and this time in a five-year-old boy from Laguna, bringing the total number of people afflicted with the disease to two. The re-emergence of the disease comes almost 20 years since the Philippines was declared polio-free in 2000. The last known case of wild poliovirus recorded in the Philippines was in 1993.
results.actions_others:
The following urgent activities are being prioritized by the DOH in collaboration with UNICEF, WHO and other partner organizations: 

•	Second round of synchronized polio vaccinations (being planned in October 2019).
•	Development and dissemination of appropriate risk communication messages 
•	Further case investigation and case finding; community search for AFP cases and close contact sampling 
•	Enhance AFP cases search and environmental surveillance by review of charts in all hospitals and health centres; and supporting community search and adding more environmental surveillance sites in Metro Manila 
•	UNICEF will support the government to procure and ensure the availability of the required vaccine supplies for the campaigns
results.summary: Philippines - Polio outbreak

results.description:
A powerful earthquake jolted several parts of Pakistan on 24th September, 2019 at 16:02 hrs, particularly areas of Azad Jammu and Kashmir, Punjab, and Khyber Pakhtunkhwa. The Earthquake severely affected Jatlan of District Mirpur, Azad Jammu & Kashmir. According to the US Geological Survey (USGS), the 5.8-magnitude earthquake struck at a shallow depth of 10 kilometers with its epicenter lying 1 km southeast of Mirpur, Azad Jammu and Kashmir. According to the preliminary information, 33 person died and more than 627 injured due the Earthquake (Local Administration 22:00 hrs). High intensity Earthquake also caused destruction of houses, buildings, and other infrastructure in District Mirpur. The main road Mirpur – Jatlan along the Jatlan Canal was damaged and huge numbers of vehicles were partially or fully damaged .The No. of deaths and injuries and affected families are likely to be increased. The electricity, mobile service, landline telephone services are disrupted however, the mobile services start working in some of areas of District Mirpur. The District Administration along with DDMA/SDMA/Police/Pakistan Army and Civil Defense  working on the search and rescue. The government declared emergency in all the hospitals of District Mirpur. The PRCS AJK also deployed its local First Aid team consisting of District First Aid Training Officer along with Trained First Aid Responders to the affected area for the provision of First Aid services and emergency evacuation.
Mirpur is one of the three divisions of the State of AJ&K. It is also a district in which there fall 2 sub‐divisions Mirpur and Dadyal having 176 and 70 villages respectively and further these 246 villages have 18 union councils. District Mirpur comprises partly plain and partly hilly areas. Mirpur lies on 33.1491N latitude and 73.7534 E longitudes. It is 134 kms away from Islamabad and 190 kms from Lahore via Dina through Grand Trunk Road. Mirpur is also connected to Bhimber (49 kms) and Kotli (99 kms) districts of the State of AJ&K. District Mirpur is bounded by district Kotli in the north and east, by Potohar (Punjab) in the west and by district Bhimber in the south. According to the census 2017, the total population of District Mirpur is 0.456 million.

results.description:
New Tropical Cyclone HIKAA's centre was located offshore approximately 305 km east of the coast of Al Wusta Governorate (eastern Oman), with maximum sustained winds of 155 km/h.	New Tropical Cyclone HIKAA's centre was located offshore approximately 305 km east of the coast of Al Wusta Governorate (eastern Oman), with maximum sustained winds of 155 km/h. HIKAA made landfall over coastal Al Wusta on the afternoon of 24 September, with maximum sustained winds up to 145 km/h before moving westward over Al Wusta and Dhofar Governorates on 25 September, with a weakening wind speed of 65-90 km/h.
Heavy rainfall, strong winds and storm surges are forecast over eastern and northern Oman on 25-26 September. Likely Heavy Rains to reach Hawf and Al-Ghaydah in Yemen.
YRCS Activated EOC in HQ and the branch level to be linked with the Operation Room in Al Mahra Governorate, Coordination is taking place with the local authorities in the governorate to face the possible effects of the Cyclone. The YRCS branch in Al Mahara listed 15 paramedics ready to be deployed if needed and additional 20 BDRT members are ready to be mobilized for rescue activities. Propositioning 400 household NFIs in Al Mahra branch which include mattresses, blanket, jerry cans, kitchen sets and hygiene kits. 
The movement partners support, IFRC is supporting in monitoring the situation and mobilizing of resources from Aden.

event_details.name: Mounting flood threats in southern and western provinces in Sri Lanka

results.description:
The prevailing showery condition for the last 72 hours, over the island is expected to continue until 25th September 2019. Showers or thundershowers will occur over most parts of the island.
Very heavy falls above 200 mm are likely at some places in Western, Southern, Sabaragamuwa and Central provinces. Heavy falls above 100 mm are likely at some places in North-western, Northern, Uva and Eastern provinces. As a result, there are flooding conditions occurred in moderate scale in some areas in Matara and Galle districts, that has affected several hundred households in two districts. 
Though the rains have subsided in the southern province, the heavy showers continue in western and Sabaragamuwa provinces that will result in increased water levels in rivers in Southern. Therefore, there is still a high risk of flooding and landslides in both most affected districts in the southern province.
results.actions_others: No information yet
results.summary: Mounting flood threats in southern and western provinces in Sri Lanka

event_details.name: YEMEN: Cyclone Hikaa approaching Arabian peninsula

results.description:
Indian Meteorological Department (IMD) this morning informed that cyclone storm "Hikaa" will reach Oman coast by September 25 early morning.
The cyclone is buffeted by 'moderate' vertical wind shear (change in wind speed and direction with height) of 24- to 37 km/hr, higher values of which can cap the storm strength. 
"Deep depression over Arabian sea intensified into a cyclonic storm Hikaa at 0530 IST on September 23 near 20.5 degrees latitude and 66.2 degrees longitude, 760 km east-southeast of Masirah (Oman). It will reach Oman coast by 25th September early morning,"
Earlier in a press release, the weather forecasting agency had predicted light to moderate rainfall in many places and heavy rainfall in isolated places in coastal districts of Saurashtra and Kutch due to the possible formation of a deep depression over east-central and north-east Arabian Sea off Gujarat coast.
results.summary: YEMEN: Cyclone Hikaa approaching Arabian peninsula

results.description:
Subsequent to a meeting with the National Emergency Advisory Council, the EOC of the Grenada Red Cross was activated at 12:30PM on Sunday, September 22, 2019. This follows information that Grenada and its dependencies have been placed under Tropical Storm warning. 4 Shelters were activated at 11AM around varying parts of the island. The National Water & Sewerage authority has advised that all water systems would be shut off at 12 Noon. The Airports at Grenada and Carriacou has been closed until 8AM September 23, 2019 or as further advised. Currently, we are experiencing severe rainfall which so far has caused minimal flooding in the south of the island and rock fall in areas prone to such. Further updates will be provided as the day progresses.

**Update 15:45 - Rainfall continues throughout the state, increasing in some parts. Tropical Storm warning remains in effect. There are reports of flooded bridges and roads which are inaccessible due to land slippage or rock fall. At present there are 11 persons in Shelters (7 females, 4 males).

**Update 18:30 - TS Karen moves 85 Miles away from Grenada. AT 5PM the center was located near latitude 12.9 North, longitude 62.7 West or about 85 miles North-west of Grenada. 

Landslides and rockfalls has been mostly cleared by MOIID Team. There was 1 report of a tree falling on a house, no casualty was reported.

There is now a total of 17 persons in shelters across the island and the NS stands ready to provide PSP, First AId or any logistical support as required. The storm continues to move away but TS warning remains in effect.

**Update - As at 8 PM NADMA has given the all-clear since the system has now moved 105 Miles away from Grenada. 

THE EOC IS NOW OFFICIALLY DEACTIVATED AS AT 8:35PM.
results.actions_others:
Meteorological Office through NADMA - Declared the state of Grenada under Tropical Storm Warning
National Water & Sewerage Authority - Shut off all water Systems
National Disaster Management Authority - Opened 5 shelters
results.summary: Grenada - Caribbean Tropical Storm Karen 22/7/2019

results.description: Tropical Storm Karen was formed 80km east north east of Tobago at 0500 hours local time. The TT Met Office issued a Tropical Storm warning for Trinidad and Tobago at 0600 hours local time. Tobago began experiencing severe weather from “feeder band” activity related to TS Karen from as early as 0300 to 0600 hours. There has been reports of flash flooding and landslides in the northern part of the island which is more hilly. In the southern and western parts there have been reports of flooding. In the capital town of Scarborough there is significant street flooding which has impacted businesses as well as the Port of Scarborough has been closed. The inter-island ferry sailing for today 09/22/2019 has all been cancelled. There has been damage to jetties in the towns of Scarborough, Roxborough and Plymouth some smaller fishing boats have been reported sank or damaged. In Trinidad there is less severe weather more rain and lighter winds. There are currently no reports of affected communities. In preparation the TTRCS with its local government partners mobilized its CERT teams to support with the distribution of sandbags to vulnerable homes. This is currently ongoing. The TTRCS Branch in Tobago is currently monitoring in preparation for early response tomorrow in collaboration with the Tobago Emergency Management Agency.
results.actions_others: Government NEOC has been activated and all 15 local government EOCs have been activated. Sandbags continue to be distributed to vulnerable homes.
results.summary: Trinidad & Tobago - Tropical Storm Karen - 09/2019

event_details.name: Belize - Partial State of Emergency - Drought - Northern, central and western regions

results.description: Belize has been experiencing drought for approximately 10 months. Yesterday the Prime Minister declared a Partial State of Emergency. Affected areas are: Corozal, Orange Walk, Belize and Cayo Districts. 418,000 acres of crops & livestock lost (sugar-30-50%; corn - 2,174 acres, Soy bean - 9,700 acres, livestock - 60,300 heads). Total estimated # of large farmers affected - 7,100; 816 small farmers. In addition the Mennonite community reports loss in rice and beans. Estimated total families affected -  7,916 - approximately 39,580 persons. Government of Belize is handling infrastructure and long term needs. Internal government discussions are ongoing today if there are needs at household levels, Belize Red Cross and Ministry of Human Services will be requested to assist, at which time, assessments will be shared. Belize Red Cross is on stand-by.
results.actions_others: Government of Belize is responding to the infrastructural and long term needs of farmers, including, moratorium in farm loan payments, reduced interest rates for loans for a period of 18 months - 2 years. All domestic banks are working along with the government to offer subsidized loans and moratorium on loan payments.
results.summary: Belize - Partial State of Emergency - Drought - Northern, central and western regions

actions_taken.summary: les évaluations continuent toujours sur le terrain vu les difficultés d’accès dans certains zones. les volontaires continuent a aider les populations dans les activités d'évacuations des eaux ainsi que le relogement de certains familles déplacées dans des familles d’accueils ou Etablissements scolaires.

results.description:
Les fortes pluies du mois de septembre dans les journées du 10, 15 et 16 septembre 2019 ont provoqué des inondations dans plusieurs localités du pays. Plusieurs quartiers sont envahis par les eaux après chaque pluie. Suite aux fortes pluies qui ont causé beaucoup de dégâts sur les moyens d’existence de plusieurs ménages, des mouvements de populations et de pertes en vie humaine, la Croix Rouge Sénégalaise en collaboration avec les autorités locales a mené une évaluation rapide dans les régions de Kaolack et Dakar. 
Les résultats des évaluations a ce jour (18/09/2019)dans  14 localités des 3 départements ont estimé que plus de 988 ménages  dont 103 déplacés vivent dans des abris provisoires avec une situation très précaire. 
06 cas de décès sont notés a Dakar dont 02 par les eaux pluies et 4 par la foudre. Neuf 09 autres morts ont ete  enregistrés dans les autres localités du pays. Les catégories les plus touchées sont les femmes, les enfants, les personnes âgées et les personnes handicapées qui vivent dans des écoles et maisons non achevées avec un accès limité aux services essentiels.
results.summary: Senegal flood septembre 2019

actions_taken.summary: Dans le cadre de l'assistance aux personnes victimes, les volontaires des branches locales de la croix rouge mènent des activités d’évaluation rapide. A cette évaluation s"ajoute des activités  appui psychosocial, d’évacuation des eaux avec les autorités locales. Ils  aident les populations a se déplacés dans les écoles ou maisons non achevés. dans le même paquet, les volontaires mènent des activités de promotion d’hygiène aux profit des personnes déplacées et relogées dans les abris provisoires.

results.description:
Le Sénégal est fortement touché par de fortes pluies dans les journées du 10, 15 et 16 septembre 2019. ces pluies ont provoqué des inondations dans plusieurs localités du pays. Plusieurs quartiers de Dakar et Kaolack sont envahis par les eaux après chaque pluie. Suite aux fortes pluies qui ont causé beaucoup de dégâts sur les moyens d’existence de plusieurs ménages, des mouvements de populations et de pertes en vie humaine, la Croix Rouge Sénégalaise en collaboration avec les autorités locales a mené une évaluation rapide de la situation dans les régions de Kaolack et Dakar. 
Les résultats des évaluations ont estimé que plus de 456 ménages sont affectés dont 51 déplacés et vivant dans des abris provisoires avec une situation très précaire. 
a ce jour, 15 cas de décès seraient notés dont 02 par les pluies et 13 autres sous l’effet de la foudre. Les catégories les plus touchées sont les femmes, les enfants, les personnes âgées et les personnes en situation d'handicap qui vivent dans des écoles et maisons non achevées avec un accès limité aux services essentiels.
results.actions_others: Les collectivités territoriales sous la supervision des Maires de Préfet de département  mènent des activités d’évacuation des eaux et d’évaluation de la situation. une action d'assistances aux victimes est effectuée à travers un relogement provisoire dans des écoles.

actions_taken.summary:
South Africa Red Cross conducted joint assessment with government at provincial offices in both affected towns of Pretoria, Johannesburg, Germiston and Richards Bay.  These towns are in different provinces across the country. The National Society also played part in the evacuation activities, hygiene promotion activities, and provision of relief items such as 200 blankets, 100 hygiene packs, 50 food parcels and provision of RFL services to the displaced people. 

The National Society is currently providing soup kitchen at all the evacuation centres and the issue of overcrowding is of a concern and the National Society is working around the clock to see how best they can help the affected people in collaboration with government and other organizations.

       
Source; SARCS Volunteers (Richards Bay and Marabastaad- Pretoria)


       
Source; SARCS Volunteers (Marabastaad- Pretoria and Katlehong- Germiston)


With the threats of disease outbreak due to overcrowding at the evacuation camps, the volunteers are doing hygiene promotions in a way to sensitize the displaced people with the tips of good hygiene. The Volunteers are also providing the displaced with psycho-social support at all the evacuation centres.  


The SARCS continue to monitor the situation and intends to expand its response through this DREF operation. It should be noted that the SARCS has the experience and capacity to carry out the proposed activities. Indeed, SARCS has a pool of volunteers who are trained in the relevant sector activities like assessment, relief distributions, WASH, Shelter, message dissemination and technical support. The National Society has been responding to different emergencies in the country including floods, structural fires, outbreak of diseases   and violence situations 

SARC have engaged 55 volunteers (10 Richards bay, 12 Pretoria,8 Johannesburg and 25 Germiston) who have been deployed across all the affected areas. The National Society will continue to monitor the situations by conducting assessment in all the affected areas.   


Overview of Red Cross Red Crescent Movement in country

Communication has been maintained with the IFRC and ICRC cluster office in Pretoria, South Africa. SARCS is in partnership with Belgian Red Cross Flanders which focuses on support for the first aid training. The National Society will continue to share reports and updates with ICRC and IFRC Cluster Office.

 
Movement Coordination

The ICRC and IFRC are present in the country and the National Society will establish coordination mechanism where reports and updates will be shared and also for the Cluster office to provide technical support to the NS where possible. 

Overview of non-RCRC actors in country

The government is working closely with South Africa Red Cross in ensuring that the affected population get assistance. The National Society is also collaborating with other Agencies (Shoprite, doctors without borders and churches) in terms of coordination. Shoprite is assisting in Katlehong (Germiston) with mobile soup kitchen which is aimed at alleviating suffering for few days as interim measure. The doctors without borders donated 10 toilets in Marabastad (Pretoria), also provided medical assistance Germiston to those needed chronic medication with assistance from department of health (local clinic). Department of health also activated environmental health practitioners whom assessed if the kitchen where SARCS prepares hot meals comply so that people are not provided with food that is contaminated.  Furthermore, International organization for migration working with home affairs and SARS assisted those who wanted to repatriated back to the country of origin.


In the affected provinces the National Society is ensuring that they work closely with relevant government stakeholders. The affected population have been assisted, but the resources are limited at the evacuation centres. The government is calling on private sectors; NGO’s to assist with donation to be able to assist the displaced population. The government provincials have also assisted with evacuation of the affected and provision of security. Government is coordinating the response activities. The National Society is also part of the Coordinating body which is chaired by the Government and the Joint Operation Centre has been activated by the government. SARCS has been lauded by government for providing assistance to the affected foreign nationals.

countries_details.name: South Africa

results.description:
Since the beginning of last week large protests and violent attacks has taken place in the capital and other parts of South Africa (Gauteng-Germiston & PTA and KZN-Richards Bay) led to injuries and loss of lives. While this is an undesirable and unfortunate consequences continue, the South African Red Cross Society (SARCS) as an impartial, neutral and humanitarian organization is exercising its mandate of being auxiliary to government by responding to this emergency.  It is especially at these times thus requiring the neutrality and services of the Red Cross, which can reach every nook and all persons regardless of their origin. 

SARCS has implemented the following activities:
•	Conducting joint needs assessment with government (Ekurhuleni, City of Joburg and Tshwane)
•	Participating on the evacuation activities (Katlehong and Richards Bay) of more than 500 people 
•	Distribution of100 hygiene packs and 200 blankets (Marabastad-Pretoria)
•	Provision of Restorative Family Links (RFL) services- assisting foreign people to make phone calls and informed their families are safe (More than 100 people assisted)
•	Provision of 50 food parcel (Richards bay)
•	Provision of food through the use of soup kitchen (Katlehong)
•	Conducted hygiene promotions/ sensitizing /awareness on possible outbreak of water-borne disease  
•	Provision of psycho social support- as affected people are traumatized by the incidents

actions_taken.summary:
The Spanish Red Cross (SpRC), with 600 personnel, staff and volunteers, has established at least 20 temporary shelters during the entire response with 19 SpRC basic life support ambulances available, where accommodation, maintenance and shelter services have been provided. For maintenance and water, the Agreement with ANEABE has been activated to provide bottled water supply in the area of Alicante, in addition to the Agreement with Carrefour to assist more than 400 people daily in the Region of Murcia and Alicante, guaranteeing the basic needs. Rescue tasks, psychosocial support and first aid services are being provided. Furthermore,  there are specialized teams from the Youth department providing services in care of children. In addition, in Castilla la Mancha, the SpRC communications immediate response team has established communications in some locations isolated by the storm. So far 1.603 people have been provided with humanitarian assistance.

From the SpRC logistics centers of Córdoba, Málaga, Ciudad Real and Madrid, 650 beds, 1.960 blankets and 1.745 hygiene kits have been mobilized to support the Red Cross response, in addition to the material pre-positioned available in the affected provinces. Both from Catalonia and Ciudad Real branches, 17 volunteers from the immediate emergency response team have deployed to the area to support the response.

The town of Almoradí, in the province of Alicante, with a population of 20,542 inhabitants, has run out of water supply caused by the overflow of the Segura river. SpRC is supporting the needs assessment, and is assessing the possibility of deploying WASH equipment, to provide safe water to the population over the next few days until the supply is restored.

event_details.name: Spain - South East: Dana - "Gota Fría" or Isolated Depression at High Altitude 09/2019

results.description:
So far, the “Gota Fría” Dana, an isolated depression at high altitude, has left six dead, more than 3,500 evacuated, the overflow of the Segura river at several points and serious destruction and economic damage still to be evaluated in Castilla-La Mancha, Murcia, Andalusia , Balearic Islands and Valencian Community.  Due to the overflow, the towns of Almoradí, Benferri and La Matanza, in the province of Alicante, have run out of water supply. At least seventy roads, eleven of them in the main network, have been affected by the storm. Rail traffic has been altered and even interrupted in different sections of the network of Murcia and the Valencian Community, and several ports in the region have also been affected. Murcia airport has remained closed this past Friday, 13th of September, while Almeria airport has been reopened after five hours with operations suspended. With rainfall that has exceeded 400 liters per square meter in 48 hours in towns such as Orihuela (Alicante), the floods have covered large areas of the provinces of Murcia, Alicante, Valencia and Almeria, where rescue and evictions have occurred. 

Looking ahead to the weekend, DANA will move to the interior of the Peninsula and will affect 21 provinces that will be at risk yellow and orange due to rains and storms.

The Spanish Red Cross (SpRC), with 600 personnel, staff and volunteers, has established at least 20 temporary shelters during the entire response with 19 SpRC basic life support ambulances available, where accommodation, meals and shelter services have been provided. For maintenance and water, the Agreement with ANEABE has been activated to provide bottled water supply in the area of Alicante, in addition to the Agreement with Carrefour to assist 400 people daily in the Region of Murcia, guaranteeing the basic needs. Rescue tasks, psychosocial support and first aid are being provided. Furthermore,  there are specialized teams from the Youth department providing services in care of children. In addition, in Castilla la Mancha, the SpRC communications immediate response team has been responsible for establishing communications in some locations isolated by the storm. So far 1603 people have been provided with humanitarian assistance.
From the SpRC logistics centers of Córdoba, Málaga, Ciudad Real and Madrid, 650 beds, 1960 blankets and 1745 hygiene kits have been mobilized to support the Red Cross response, in addition to the material pre-positioned available in the affected provinces. Both from Catalonia and Ciudad Real branches, 17 volunteers from the immediate emergency response team have deployed to the area to support the response.

The town of Almoradí, in the province of Alicante, with a population of 20,542 inhabitants, has run out of water supply caused by the overflow of the Segura river. SpRC is supporting the needs assessment, and is assessing the possibility of deploying WASH equipment, to provide safe water to the population over the next few days until the supply is restored.
results.actions_others: The Government has deployed more than a thousand troops from the state security forces and bodies, 4 helicopters, 10 vessels, 300 tactical vehicles in Orihuela and Murcia. All these troops are carrying out cleaning, flow control, surveillance, rescue and evacuation tasks, verification of bridge breakage, restoration of roads, etc
results.summary: Spain - South East: Dana - "Gota Fría" or Isolated Depression at High Altitude 09/2019

event_details.name: Incremento en la Actividad  del Volcán Copahue

results.description:
De acuerdo con la información proporcionada por OVDAS – SERNAGEOMIN, mediante su Reporte Especial de Actividad Volcánica (REAV) del Volcán Copahue, emitido durante la presente jornada, se reporta que este mantiene su nivel de alerta técnica en Nivel Amarillo, comprendiendo variaciones en los niveles, según los parámetros derivados de la vigilancia que indican que el volcán está por encima de su umbral base y que el proceso es inestable, pudiendo evolucionar aumentando o disminuyendo esos niveles, por lo que una erupción probable se podría desarrollar en un periodo de semanas o meses.

En base a lo indicado en el último REAV, se informa que desde las 16:57 del día de ayer 11 de septiembre, las estaciones de monitoreo volcánico instaladas en las inmediaciones del volcán Copahue, han registrado sismicidad de largo periodo (LP) de baja energía, que se correlacionan con señales de infrasonido y están asociados con la actividad volcánica superficial a nivel del cráter, manifestada a través de la ocurrencia de explosiones de magnitud menor, con emisiones de gases y cenizas, que generaron columnas de baja altura. 

Debido a esto, aún persisten condiciones que posibilitarían una mayor inestabilidad del sistema volcánico, implicando la ocurrencia de emisiones de cenizas y/o posibilidad de explosiones menores que afecten áreas cercanas al cráter.
results.actions_others:
la Intendencia de la Región del Biobío en coordinación con la Dirección Regional de ONEMI mantiene la Alerta Amarilla para la comuna de Alto Biobío por actividad del Volcán Copahue, que se encuentra vigente desde el 05 de abril de 2019.

Con lo anterior, el Sistema de Protección Civil recomienda mantener preventivamente restricciones al acceso en torno al cráter activo con un radio de 500 metros.

SERNAGEOMIN por su parte, continúa con la vigilancia permanente del volcán y la Dirección Regional de ONEMI Biobío, mantendrá las coordinaciones con los integrantes del Sistema de Protección Civil para alertar oportunamente y dar adecuada respuesta ante eventuales situaciones de emergencia.
results.summary: Incremento en la Actividad  del Volcán Copahue

event_details.name: Incremento en la Actividad Volcánica Complejo Nevados de Chillan /Alerta Naranja

results.description:
De acuerdo con la información proporcionada por OVDAS – SERNAGEOMIN, a través de su Reporte Especial de Actividad Volcánica (REAV) del Complejo Volcánico Nevados de Chillán, se mantiene el nivel de alerta técnica en Nivel Naranja, situación que comprende variaciones significativas en el desarrollo del proceso volcánico derivadas del análisis de indicadores de los parámetros de vigilancia, donde una erupción probable se podría desarrollar en un periodo de días o semanas.

En tanto, en relación al último REAV, se indica que a las 07:12 horas de hoy, las estaciones de monitoreo instaladas en las inmediaciones del Complejo Volcánico Nevados de Chillán registraron 1 sismo asociado a la dinámica de fluidos al interior del sistema volcánico (Largo Periodo).

En relación a lo anterior, se mantiene la Alerta Amarilla del Sistema de Protección Civil, para las comunas de Pinto, Coihueco y San Fabián, Región de Ñuble, por actividad del Complejo Volcánico Nevados de Chillán
results.actions_others:
Por actividad del Complejo Volcánico Nevados de Chillán, las autoridades recomiendan no acercarse al cráter activo, manteniendo una distancia mínima de 3 km por el SO (Valle Las Trancas – Termas de Chillán) y de 5 km por el E-NE (San Fabián), manteniendo el alistamiento de los planes de emergencia en las zonas de potencial peligro, comunicado diariamente por SERNAGEOMIN, en los Reportes de Actividad Volcánica (RAV), a través de su Mapa de Peligros Volcánicos del complejo.

Finalmente, SERNAGEOMIN continúa con la vigilancia permanente del complejo volcánico y las Direcciones Regionales de ONEMI mantendrán las coordinaciones con los integrantes del Sistema de Protección Civil para alertar oportunamente y dar adecuada respuesta ante eventuales situaciones de emergencia.
results.summary: Incremento en la Actividad Volcánica Complejo Nevados de Chillan /Alerta Naranja
