event_details.name: An earthquake with a magnitude of 5.7 hit southern part of Iran.

results.description:
An earthquake with a magnitude of 5.7, depth 17 km, had hit southern part of Iran in Masjed Soleyman and Golgir in Khoozestan province on Monday 8 July 2019 at 11:30 a.m, local time. So far, more than 7 aftershocks have been recorded, the biggest of which has been 4.7 on the Richter scale. 
According to the assessments and the local government announcements, no casualties or big damages have been reported. However, one of the hospitals of the city has been evacuated due to the threat of collapsing walls and unsafe conditions. Assessments carried out in the affected villages identified 15 local houses  with partial light damages and 8 houses have been damaged up to 50 percent.  45 injuries have been reported due to the earthquake and one dead because of a heart attack.
results.summary: An earthquake with a magnitude of 5.7 hit southern part of Iran.

contacts.name: Ruben Cano
contacts.title: Head of Office, West Coast Cluster

results.description:
In the last one month (June) different parts of the country have witnessed torrential rain falls resulting in widespread flooding. 

The flooding cut across the six (6) geo-political zones in Nigeria viz-a-viz: three (3) States in the North West, three (3) States in the North Central, three (3) States in the North East, two (2) States in the South East, three (3) States in the South South and four (4) States in the South West totaling 18 states out of the total 36 states in Nigeria. 

In Jigawa state, two (2) major LGAs were affected: Dutse Municipal Council and Birnin Kudu, not less than 625 houses collapsed and farmers livelihoods were affected when floods water washed away hundreds of hectares of farm lands with matured crops approaching harvesting. Floods rampaged some communities in Anambra State including but not limited to 10 communities in Ayamelum Local Government Area. Farm land and farm produce were washed away in communities like Innoma, Odekpe, Igbokenyi, Ode, Ukwala among others.
The reports received from local Branches of Nigerian Red Cross Society (NRCS) indicate that 105  communities in 52 Local Government Areas of 18 States of: Anambra, Edo, Delta, Bauchi, Katsina, Ogun, Oyo Ondo, Zamfara, Gombe, Plateau, Niger, Lagos, Yobe, Cross River, Enugu, Jigawa and Kwara reported floods affecting 105 communities in all according to our internal reports update as at Monday, 1st July, 2019. In the affected States, 3,279 persons already displaced, more than 300,000 people directly affected, 50 people hospitalized, 209 persons injured, 42 death and one person missing as well as damages to several hectares of farmlands with crops such as yam, cassava, millet, rice, maize, Guinea corns, beans, onions and many other crops including domestic animals such as sheep, goats and birds from poultry farms were washed away. Critical infrastructures like roads, culverts, bridges, telecommunication masts, base stations, grid lines among others were damaged with some major roads becoming unpassable. Farmers and other commuters have to be using longer routes as alternatives with attendant cost implications and protection issues in addition to already worsening security situations across length and breadth of Nigeria. More and more people are getting traumatized with the losses of their loved ones, means of livelihoods like farm produce and poultry farms and other economic trees and plants among other causes of trauma.
It will be recalled that most of these communities and LGAs were severely affected during the 2012 and 2018 flood disasters. 
The Nigeria Hydrological Services Agency (NIHSA), a Federal Government Agency under the Federal Ministry of Water Resources released its annual flood outlook, detailing that, seventy-four (74) Local Government Areas (LGAs) in 30 States in Nigeria are likely to experience severe flooding in the months of July, August and September 2019. 
With the 2019 Nigeria floods outlook released by the NIHSA, the worst is yet to come with little or no preparedness put in place. Now, is the time.
results.actions_others: States Emergency Management Agencies in the affected States have commenced sensitization across states encouraging communities at risk to move or relocate to safer places.
results.summary: Nigeria Floods, 2019

sources.spec: National Directorate General For Disaster Management

results.description:
Devastating storm cells hit Eastern Hungary on 27th afternoon, leaving 80 settlements affected by damages caused by strong wind and heavy rainfall. According to the National DM Authority more than thousand rooftops have been damaged, while trees fallen on properties caused further damages. Hungarian Red Cross immediately started the coordination of the assistance with the relevant authorities. According to the ongoing assessment, the most affected villages are Nyírmada, Pusztadobos and Nyírkarász, where majority of the private homes suffered damages. Due income difficulties only a few households have access to insurance solutions in the region.
Hungarian Government officially requested assistance from the National Society trough the Szabolcs-Szatmár-Bereg county's government office. Damages are being reported constantly and continuously by citizens for the municipalities, number of affected households and population is under registration coordinated by the Authorities. Firefighters are working to clear the roads and eliminate further danger (eg. trees fallen on aerial cords).
results.actions_others: National DM (NDGDM) is working to clear the roads and eliminate further danger caused by fallen trees and damaged firewalls. Firefighters from far corners of the country have been deployed to support the technical rescue activities. NDGDM and municipalities are providing cover sheets for short-term temporary coverage of rooftops. Government Office in the region is coordinating the different efforts, and requested assistance from national charity organisations.
results.summary: Devastating storm in Eastern-Hungary

actions_taken.summary: German Red Cross country officer provided initial cash contribution of Euros. 1,000 that facilitated the URCS to effectively conduct detailed needs assessment and distribution of HHIs in Bududa district, as immediate response to the landslide disaster. These supplies are enhancing resilience of target households which will hopefully assist them to absorb the after shocks thus reducing adverse effects of this cholera outbreak.

Community-based volunteers, who have been members of Community- Based Disaster Risk Reduction (CBDR) groups have initiated health and hygiene promotion interventions in the affected communities, as well as identifying suspect cases and referring them to the Cholera Treatment Unit. The URCS is monitoring the disease progression and considering deployment of Oral Re-hydration Point (ORP) kits if warranted by increasing caseloads.

The IFRC previously approved a DREF request worth CHF 230,972 to facilitate response to the landslide and floods events that affected the Bududa, Butaleja, Mable and Sironko districts.  This DREF support will ensure enhanced hygiene and health promotion interventions, distribution of cholera prevention IEC materials, as well as distribution of  HHIs, water and hygiene supplies that will facilitate rapid control of the cholera outbreak and prevent the spread of other potential communicable diseases that might arise as the effects of the landslides and floods disasters.

sources.spec: Ministry of Health, Public Emergency Operations Centre (PHEOC)

results.description: Just two weeks after a devastating Landslide disaster hit Bududa district, Eastern Uganda  on 5th June 2019, causing six (6) deaths, and injuries to 27 persons in several sub-counties of Buwali, Bukalasi/Bundesi, Bumayoka and parts of Bubiita, cholera outbreak has been confirmed after laboratory results at Mbale regional referral Hospital on 19th June isolated vibro cholerae 01 inaba from samples of a 2 year-old male, a 8 year-old female patients being managed at Bukigai Health centre III, including a 40 year-old male patient admitted at Bududa Hospital.  By 24th June 2019, a total of 9 cases warere si far reported.The cholera cases are coming from Buwali, Bushika, Nakatsi, Bushiyi and Bulucheke where the people affected by the landslide are currently displaced.One of the suspect cases is from Mbale district which was also affected by floods disaster during the same time period. As the rains continue, with devastated sanitation infrastructures and lack of safe water supply, the cholera situation might escalate, affecting all floods-affected areas of Mbale, Sironko and Butaleja districts.
results.actions_others: The Ministry of Health conducted the laboratory conformation at Mbale Regional referral Hospital, and established cholera treatment units at Bukigai HCIII and Bududa hospital where all cases are being treated.
results.summary: Cholera outbreak affects Bududa Landslide

event_details.name: At least 69 people were wounded since the violence broke out in Tbilisi, Georgia

results.description:
On June 20, 2019, the session of the Inter-parliamentary assembly on orthodoxy was opened in the parliament of Georgia, which was attended by up to 100 members of 25 delegations. The President of the Inter-Parliamentary Assembly on Orthodoxy, Sergei Gavrilov, a deputy of the Russian Duma from the Communist Party, was leading the session. The parliamentary opposition protested against the conduct of the Assembly, accusing Gavrilov’s violation of the Law of Georgia on the Occupied Territories. Opposition party European Georgia protested the presence of the “occupant state’s representative, who was in Abkhazia during 1992-93 armed conflict and who is responsible for recognition of ABkhazia and Samachablo, as he was in Russian Federation Duma when recognition document was signed.” 
Citizens of Georgia have blocked Rustaveli Avenue in front of the Parliament. The above was initially resisted by law enforcement officers, but later they allowed protesters to block the road. Citizens are protesting against the fact that Russian MP Sergei Gavrilov presided over the session of the Inter-Parliamentary Assembly on Orthodoxy in the Parliament of Georgia today.
Yesterday Clashes were taking place between protesters and police, as the latter was not letting the demonstrators to enter the parliament building. The confrontation started when protesters tried to push through the police cordon. Police used water cannons, tear gas and rubber bullets and Rubber Slug "Javelin" Law Enforcement Projectile (see description here https://www.firequest.com/NL122.html) to disperse the demonstrators. At least 30 civilians and 39 security forces were wounded since the violence during protest broke out yesterday. There are dozens of media representatives among victims of rubber bullets and violence. Police cleared Tbilisi streets of protesters by the morning of June 21.
Today the protests are renewed and as we can see the situation will be continued for a prolonged period of time.
results.actions_others: necessary medical services were provided. Evacuation of people
results.summary: At least 69 people were wounded since the violence broke out in Tbilisi, Georgia

event_details.name: Excessive summer rainfall caused flash floods and floods in Turkey

results.description:
In the last several days, the Republic of Turkey was affected by excessive rainfall.  11 municipalities and cities reported that they were affected by heavy rain and flash floods and floods. Most affected areas were in middle and north Anatolia including; Ankara, Bartın, Çankiri, Düzce, Elazığ, Kayseri, Manisa, Ordu, Samsun, Trapzon and Zonguldak provinces.
A flood occurred in the Etimesgut district of Ankara on 9 June 019 due to the excessive rainfall and many neighborhoods were affected. Following the receipt of the disaster message, TRC’s Disaster Management Directorate became alarmed and initiated disaster response activities.
On 16 June 2019, in Tiyenli neighborhood of the Gölmarmara district of Manisa province was flooded due to heavy rainfall and approximately 50 people were affected. After having received the disaster alert, TRC’s National Disaster Management Directorate and the Aegean Regional Disaster Management Center alarmed their units and initiated disaster response activities.
On 16 June 019,  28 tents accommodating seasonal workers were flooded due to the excessive rainfall in the Kızılırmak district of Çankırı province and approximately 350 people were affected. Following the news of the disaster, the Turkish Red Crescent (TRC) National Disaster Management Directorate and Çankırı Branch alarmed their units initiated disaster response activities. 
 On 18 June 2019, Düzce provınce Gölyaka district was flooded as a result of excessive rainfall, 8 households (34 persons) were affected by floods.7 staff and 3 vehicles from the West Black Sea Regional Disaster Management Center and 9 volunteers from Düzce Branch were deployed to the field.7 staff and 3 vehicles from the West Black Sea Regional Disaster Management Center and 9 volunteers from Düzce Branch were deployed to the field.
On 18 June 2019, following the flood caused by the explosion of the hydroelectric power plant (HEPP) pipe in Araklı district of Trabzon province, 14 people were rescued alive and 4 people died. Another 4 wounded people who were rescued were taken to hospital.Following the receipt of the disaster messaga, the Disaster Management Directorate, Northeast Anatolia Regional Disaster Management Center, Trabzon Local Disaster Management Center and Trabzon Branch Directorate became alarmed and initiated disaster response activities.
On 19 June 2019, 14 tents of seasonal workers were flooded and about 80 people were affected. as a result of excessive rainfall in the Kocasinan district of Kayseri province, Himmetdede neighborhood. Following the receipt of the report of the disaster, the Disaster Management Directorate and the Mediterranean Regional Disaster Management Center and Kayseri Branch became alerted and disaster response activities were initiated.
There were Relief items such as; clean water, soup, a hot meal, cake, food package, hygiene set, and blanket, which the Turkish Red Crescent delivered to the victims of the flood.
results.summary: Excessive summer rainfall caused flash floods and floods in Turkey

event_details.name: Inundaciones junio 2019 - Uruguay. Cantidad de personas afectadas 5808 (registradas).

results.description:
A causa de las presentes lluvias que afectan el territorio nacional desde el pasado 11 de junio 2019, la creciente en los diferentes ríos al igual que arroyos generaron al día de la fecha que 5808 personas abandonaran su hogar. 
De las cifras anteriormente mencionadas 3496 son personas autoevacuadas (registradas) y 2312 personas evacuadas que se encuentran alojadas en albergues dispuestos por los Comité Departamentales de Emergencia (CDE) y del Centro Coordinador de Emergencias Departamentales (CECOED). 
El evento genero impacto en 8 departamentos del país, Canelones, Durazno, Flores, Florida, Rio Negro, San José, Soriano y Treinta y Tres. A su vez el evento ha generado cortes en diferentes tramos de12 rutas nacionales. La situación ha generado la limitación del suministro de energía eléctrica en 3600 hogares, siendo la zona céntrica del país la más afectada. 
Según informa el Sistema Nacional de Emergencia de acuerdo con sus protocolos de acción el nivel de respuesta se mantiene a nivel departamental.
results.actions_others: El Estado se ha encargado de gestionar las acciones para la evacuación de las personas afectadas y su reubicación en albergues otorgando alimentación durante su permanencia. Realiza el registro de las personas autoevacuadas , identificando necesidades.
results.summary: Inundaciones junio 2019 - Uruguay. Cantidad de personas afectadas 5808 (registradas).

results.description: Abnormal heat has established in the Republic of Belarus, for two weeks already the air temperature stands at + 32 ° C and higher. Belarus Red Cross is actively working on assisting the population. BRCS staff and volunteers of disaster response teams are providing first aid to the population affected by abnormally high temperature ranges, are informing the population on how to behave during extremely high temperature conditions and distributing water in places of large concentrations of people. More than 12,000 people have received assistance as of June 14, 2019. About 70 volunteers of BRCS disaster response teams throughout Belarus are involved in actions to assist the population.

actions_taken.summary:
Since the EVD outbreak was declared in the DRC in August 2018, URCS has been providing screening at major PoEs along the boarder with  DRC, as well as conducting risk communications interventions. Safe and Dignified Burial (SDB) team have been trained, with its pre-positioned in country to support IPC and SDB needs, if warranted. These activities will be re-activated and heightened.  
URCS National and Branch staff are now participating in an emergency District Task Force (DTF) Meeting called in the night in Kasese district, and will attend NTF meeting called for Wednesday 12/06/2019.

sources.spec: Uganda Red Cross Society, Kasese Branch office

results.description: The Ugandan Ministry of Health has confirmed an outbreak of Ebola Virus Disease (EVD) after a case is detected in Kasese district at the border of the Democratic Republic of Congo(DRC). The conformed case is a 5 year-old boy who has been isolated at Bwera Hospital Ebola Treatment Unit (ETU) as he undergoes treatment. The Ministry of Health has dispatched team of epidemiologists and EVD experts to support the districts in quickly tracing the contacts, and providing treatment to the case on admission.
results.actions_others: All actors involved in EVD preparedness, including World Health Organization, UNICEF, WFP,  IOM  will heighten their respective interventions to strengthen  all pillars for effective EVD management.
results.summary: Ebola case confirmed in Uganda

event_details.name: 3 people died due to strong windstorm

results.description: On the 6th June a windstorm affected two districts in the far Western Region of Nepal ( Kailali and Kanchanpur ).  Latest information from NRCS/IFRC is that  3546 families have been affected, three people have been killed, 116 people have been injured and 2370 families have been displaced.  The NEOC has confirmed informally that the response is being handled by the local, district and provincial authorities and that there is no need for action from the HCT
results.actions_others:
The Ministry of Home Affairs and NEOC is actively coordinating with District Disaster Management Committee to conduct Initial Rapid Assessment, consolidate report and sharing the report. District government has mobilized security forces for search rescue, assessment and relief distribution. DDMC of Kailali district has conducted emergency meeting immediately after the storm and formed task team to ensure one-door system. The task team is headed by Assistant CDO. The Task team has mobilized relief materials (Tarpaulin and NFRI) from Army, NRCS, LWF and other local stakeholders to meet the needs. The DDMC has completed Initial Rapid Assessment and detail assessment is now started and continued.

The NRCS has provided non-food relief items including tarpaulins for 1185 families and NFRI for 70 families. UNICEF is providing bed nets and tarpaulins for 600 families via the District Disaster Management Committee (DDMC) following a request from local Government. The Rotary Club of Nepal and LWF are also responding.
results.summary: 3 people died due to strong windstorm

actions_taken.summary: German Red Cross has supported the URCS with an initial amount of Euros 1,000 that is assisting the National Society to conduct more detailed needs assessment.

The URCS conducted rapid needs assessment and continue to closely monitor the trend of events as increasing rains are still experienced.   
In Bududa, the Bubulo Branch of Uganda Red Cross worked with Uganda Police and Uganda People's Defense Forces (UPDF) in the provision of search and rescue operation and referral of injured victims to Bududa hospital. URCS volunteers are also supporting medical staff at Bududa Hospital by providing  First Aid and psychosocial support assistance to the inured and bereaved families. 
In Kampala, the URCS provided 20 shelter tents that has been providing temporary accommodation to 200 displaced persons, in addition to 100 blankets distributed to most vulnerable among the displaced persons.  In a related event, URCS first response team worked with Uganda Police Fire Brigade and evacuated two bodies from a collapsed coffee shop in Kampala on June 4, 2019.  The URCS communications department issued two press releases that helped to provide public information and community awareness about the disaster situation.

IFRC country team have been supporting the URCS in conducting emergency needs assessment and sharing information with the Red Cross movement partners as well as other external partners. the country team and operations team at the East African cluster have been providing technical input for the NS to develop EPOA. IFRC is continuing to monitor the situation.

sources.spec: Ministry of Disaster & Refugees, Office of the Prime Minister

event_details.name: Six dead after a Landslide disaster in Bududa district, Uganda

results.description:
Persistent torrential rains is currently affecting many part of Uganda causing associated impacts, including flooding in low lying areas of Kampala, Mukono, Mbale, Butaleja and Manafwa districts as well as new episode of landslides in Bududa district.     

Just after the recent flash floods that triggered landslide in Bududa district in October 2018, torrential rains that intensified in the months of May and the first week of June 2019 has again caused a new wave of landslide disasters in Bududa, as well as flooding emergencies in low-lying areas of Mbale and Butaleja districts. The landslides were triggered by a heavy and continuous downpour that was experienced on 4th June, 2019 from 8:00pm until the next morning, 4:00am on 5th June, 2019. The landslides hit several sub-counties with most affected being Buwali and Bukalasi/Bundesi, Bumayoka and parts of Bubiita in the lower stream which is affected by flashfloods. 
There are majorly 4 landslides scenes thus, one in Bumayoka sub-county, another one in Bukalasi/ Bundesi and two in Buwali. The landslide caused six (6) deaths, and injuries to 27 persons (13 males & 14 females) all still admitted at Bududa Hospital, with positive prognosis from the treatment. Two (02) patients among those admitted are children under 5years (1 male & 1 female). A total of eighty (80) households are currently displaced  
A week before the landslide incident, heavy rains hit several areas of Uganda including the Capital, Kampala  on the 26th of May 2019. The rains flooded several of areas destroying infrastructure, cut-off roads networks with properties worth millions of shillings, including poultry farms and other livelihoods activities all destroyed. At least eight (08) deaths have been reported in Kikajjo, Lubowa and Lufuka all located in Masajja and Bunamwaya divisions (Kampala suburbs). The flooding has directly affected 439 households (3,131 people)
results.actions_others: Ministry of Disaster and Refugees  in the Office of the Prime Minister deployed technical team to support local response of the district Disaster Management  Committee and also issued a statement for planned delivery of food aid to Bududa district. In Kampala, no other partner provided any form of assistance to displaced persons, apart from support to meet burial expenses provided to bereaved families by the area Member of Parliament. The Uganda Police Fire Brigade led the evacuation of the 2 dead bodies from the collapsed coffee shop at Namirembe Guest House in Kampala. Uganda National Meteorological Authority (UNMA) is continuing to provide weather forecast as early warning for more rains.
results.summary: Six dead after a Landslide disaster in Bududa district, Uganda

The sowing areas are mainly affected by fallow wheat. The size of the damage is being clarified through the commission and will be provided soon.
results.summary: Strong wind and hail recorded in Shirak province in the evening of June 4 have caused major damage.

event_details.name: Wildfires in several places in Israel, some houses destroyed, villages were evacuated, few injured.

results.description: Friday, May 24th is the second day of the heatwave in Israel, with the highest temperatures measured in Isreal for this year. The advance of the fires that started yesterday has been stopped in most of the places but in a few places, the fires are not yet under control. Evacuation orders have been issued for several villages (Kibbutz Harel, Mevo Modi'im, Tarom, Beit Ezra, Iksal, Negohot, Pdoel). Roads 44, 443, 4, 60 and 1 are blocked in areas where the fire is close to the roads. Firefighters are using trucks, helicopters, and planes to battle the flames, with the support of international aid of planes from Greece, Cyprus, Italy and Croatia, and helicopters from Egypt. In Kibbutz Harel 16 houses were destroyed, and in Mevo Modi'im another 40 houses were damaged. Today 14 were injured lightly from smoke inhalation near Negohot and were treated by MDA. By Saturday the heatwave is expected to ease.
results.summary: A second day of wildfires in several places in Israel, villages are evacuated, few injured

actions_taken.summary:
MDA treated and transported 11 casualties:
- 2 mildly injured (child and adult)
- 9 lightly injured (3 children and 6 adults)

event_details.name: Wildfires in several places in Israel, some houses destroyed, villages were evacuated, few injured.

results.description: A heatwave stroke Israel this week and intensified on Thursday, May 23rd with warm and dry weather conditions. As a result, wildfires broke out in several locations in the center and south of Israel. As precaution police blocked several main roads (44, 443, 1). Authorities issued evacuation orders for some houses as the flames began spreading to residential areas in several villages (A large fire in the Jerusalem hills led to the evacuation of Kibbutz Harel. Residents of Mavo Modi'in, Gamzu, Shilat, Kfar Rut, and Kfar Daniel were also asked to evacuate their homes due to fires in the Ben Shemen woodlands). 16 houses were destroyed in Kibbutz Harel. Firefighters are using trucks, helicopters, and planes to battle the flames. The severe weather conditions are expected to continue also on Friday, and by Saturday the heatwave will begin to ease. MDA responded to 95 emergency dispatches and treated 11 casualties- 2 with mild injuries and 9 lightly injured. 4 of the casualties are children.
results.summary: Wildfires in several places in Israel, some houses destroyed, villages were evacuated, few injured.

actions_taken.summary: The NS is involve in the joint needs assessment

event_details.name: Massive population influx in the region of Maradi in Nigern

results.description:
The Niger’s region of Maradi is experiencing an influx of Nigerian refugees fleeing the violence generated by terrorist groups in the states of Kano, Katsina and Sokoto. According to reports, confirmed by local sources and humanitarian organizations, in recent days alone, more than 3,000 people from the Sabon Birni area in Sokoto State have arrived in Niger, particularly in the villages of Dan Kano 1 and 2 located in the town of Tibiri, under the department of Guidan Roumji.

 The influx of Nigerian refugees continues to grow and, according to some sources, the number of Nigerian refugees in this part of Niger could rise to nearly 20,000 at present. No census has yet been done to date and most importantly, the first arrivals have mixed with the local population as many have families on both sides of the border.

Regional authorities and humanitarian organizations have begun to take the problem seriously and according to our sources, a joint mission made of regional authorities, heads of the defense and security forces as well as humanitarian organizations including the United Nations system, is expected at the level of the sites concerned.

Nigerian refugees flee the violence of what is now considered the "North-West Front", in opposition to the "North-East Front", where there are terrorist groups including Boko Haram. The "North-West Front" concerns the Kano, Katsina and Sokoto States in Nigeria, which are adjacent to the Zinder, Maradi and Tahoua regions of Niger. For almost a year now, this part of Nigeria has seen a rise in the number of terrorist groups whose acts of violence are beginning to take on serious proportions.

A few months ago, it was reported that one of these groups who call themselves "jihadists" tried to install one of its bases in the area of Konni in the department of Tahoua. The Niger authorities have deployed a major security device to counter the threat that has continued to grow on the other side of the border.
With regards to this new influx of Nigerian refugees, the humanitarian organizations specially the UN agencies have meet with the regional administrative authorities to organize humanitarian assistance to the 20,000 refugees. Therefore, a meeting was held at the governor office on 17 May 2019 and three days later, on 20th May 2019 a second meeting was held to design the joint needs assessment mission prescribe by the Niger’s administrative authorities. As such two teams were put in place for the needs assessment. These include:

Protection and shelter area:	UNHCR, WFP, UNICEF, UNHCR’s partner organizations and Regional Directorate of civil status and Refugees
Health Nutrition and WASH area: WHO, WFP and Regional Directorate for Public Health;
Food Security area: FAO, WFP and Regional Directorate of Agriculture and Rural Development
General situation overview	: UNOCHA, Governor of the region, Regional Directorate for Civil status and Refugees,  

The needs assessment is schedule for Friday 24 May 2019.
results.actions_others: The Government, the UN agencies and humanitarian organisations are planning for needs assessment schedule for Friday
results.summary: Massive population influx in the region of Maradi in Niger

results.description:
Ukraine suffers from flood and hurricanes. Rains caused an emergency situation in west regions of Ukraine.
Hurricane demolished 100 hectares of trees in the Zhytomyr region, flooding flooded dozens of houses in the Prykarpattia region, and night rain flooded the streets in the city Kropivnitskogo. 
A hurricane in the Zhytomyr region went through the cities of Novograd-Volynsky, Emilchino and Gorodnitsa. Bad weather distorted the forest, the trees were destroyed in minutes.
Whirlwind destroyed uneven-aged deciduous and coniferous trees, as well as destroys the greenhouses in which planting material is grown. The death of such a number of trees can be assessed as a local emergency. 
In the village Mykulychyn in Ivano-Frankivsk region a lot of rain fell, because of what the water level rose in the local creek Meresny. Water flowed from it onto the road, blocked traffic and flooded 60 houses as well as the territory near them.
The water level in the flooded buildings reached 10-30 centimeters, so the residents of the house had to leave their homes and go to their relatives. On May 20, as a result of intensive rainfall in the form of rain in the Nadvirnyansky, Bogorodchany districts and Kalush (total 22 settlements), there was a rise in water level, resulting in the flooding of some 3,240 households, partly damaged 2 bridges of local importance, 2 populated points from gas supply (about 1 thousand subscribers).
The departments of the MES carried out the evacuation of 60 people.
In the village of Kraische in the Carpathians, the water destroyed 800 meters of the road.
As a result of the bad weather, no one was hurt. 
Due to heavy rains, 300 houses and administrative buildings in the village of Yamnitsa were flooded. The water level in some buildings is from 20 to 100 centimeters. This is because the water level in the Pavlovka River has risen above the level of the protective dam. Rescuers had to evacuate 4 people.
The rivers Strymba and Vorona overflowed and flooded houses. On some streets can only move by boat.
results.actions_others: To assist the population, 126 people, 26 units of facilities, 19 units of cars and 9 swimming equipments were involved from MES.
results.summary: Flooding in Western Ukraine

actions_taken.summary: Following the Easter Sunday attack there is a need to provide psychosocial support to the many people affected – to help them cope better with the death and injuries of family members. Sri Lanka Red Cross is currently conducting a detailed needs assessment and planning exercise.

countries_details.society_name: The Sri Lanka Red Cross Society
countries_details.name: Sri Lanka

event_details.name: Easter Sunday Attack in Sri Lanka

results.description:
The attacks on the 21 April 2019 killed at least 253 people and wounded more than 500 people. At least 40 foreign
nationals and at least 45 children are reported to be among the dead. These attacks affected the country as a whole.
Inter-ethnic anxiety has risen in the affected districts as well as in the country in general. There is a need to assist the
people who were directly affected as well as the wider communities, to reduce tensions within communities and promote
a culture of peace. Sri Lanka Red Cross Society is a neutral and impartial humanitarian organization that can reach
all types of communities without any form of discrimination, and focusing its actions in addressing the
humanitarian needs. At the same time, engaging with communities to embed a culture of peace.
results.summary: Easter Sunday Attack

event_details.name: 6 dead in an active snowstorm in Mongolia

results.description:
Heavy snowfall and violent wind gusts hit southern parts of the country including Khentii, Tuv, Dornogovi, Umnugovi, Bayankhongor, Uvurkhangai, and Govi-Altai provinces between 10 May and 11 May 2019. As stated by NAMEM1, wind speeds fluctuated between 18 and 24 m/s (-17 degrees Celsius wind chill factor2) and reached 28 to 30 m/s (-24 degrees Celsius wind chill factor), in Altai, Tonkhil, and Sharga soums3 of Govi-Altai province, and Jinst soum of Bayankhongor province. Even though early warnings were disseminated through media channels, including television and radio, social media by local meteorology offices, and emergency management agencies on 10 May, there were many calls from herders to emergency agencies for losing their livestock in the snowstorm. Most herders had their livestock grazing out in the field as it was tranquil in the morning, and then a sudden change of weather occurred within 30 to 40 minutes, according to the herders.

Snowdrifts and blowing snow induced poor visibility of less than 0.5 kilometers (as stated by herders) and disrupted movement between cities due to road closures in many areas. The weather forced livestock into the wilderness and severely affected the herdsmen. The overall damage caused by the snowstorm in Mongolia has not yet been officially announced, but known losses include 20 households from 8 soums in Umnugovi province that lost about 3,000 livestock in sheep units4, while another 10 households are still looking for their lost livestock. Also, roughly 2,000 horses from Delgerekh and Ikhkhet soums were driven across the border to China in Dornogovi province, and 11,592 livestock in sheep units perished during the snowstorm in Zuunbayan-Ulaan, Bogd, and Guchin-Us soums of Uvurkhangai province.

The most tragic cases happened in Umnugovi province in which three (3) persons in Tsogt-tsetsii soum and one (1) person in Sevrei soum got lost in the snowstorm and were later found dead by the local emergency management agency around midnight on 12 May, and in Bogd soum of Uvurkhangai province where two (2) persons were found dead on 13 May. The police stated that most people started wearing thinner clothes and, since the weather had been warmer, the sudden snowstorm caught them off guard. The victims seem to have gotten lost while following their livestock, which had been driven off by the storm. Massive snowfall (25 to 30 cm, as stated by local authorities) accumulated and is now melting, causing a potential risk of flash floods in Sevrei and Tsogttsetsii soums of Umnugovi province.
results.actions_others: Early warnings were disseminated by both local emergency management agencies and the meteorology office. Local emergency management agencies deployed search and rescue teams along with specialized units from local police agencies to track missing people and livestock as calls were received from the people. Currently, Ulaanbaatar – Dornogovi – Ulaanbaatar, Ulaanbaatar – Khentii – Ulaanbaatar, and Ulaanbaatar – Umnugovi – Ulaanbaatar roads have been closed for safety reasons. In addition, NAMEM has also warned of another potential storm on 14 May night.
results.summary: 6 dead in an active snowstorm in Mongolia

event_details.name: Over 1285 cases of measels and 5 dead in measels outbrake in Republic of North Macedonia

results.description:
On April 16, 2019, the Ministry of Health declared a morbilli epidemic at the national level on the recommendation of the Commission for Infectious Diseases, in order to prevent the further spread of measles. In total, since the beginning of the epidemic in December 2018, as of May 02, 2019, in the Republic of Northern Macedonia, 1285 cases of measles have been registered with a disease rate of 62.1 per 100,000 inhabitants, which represents the highest number of registered cases in the last 10 years. According to the place of permanent residence, cases of measles are registered in 21 cities of the country, of which 797 cases are from Skopje, Kumanovo-134, Tetovo-108, Struga-71, Kichevo-38, Veles-26, Gostivar -35, Gevgelija -18, Debar-17, and in other cities less than 10 cases. The largest number of cases are from the age group over 30 years - 555. 217 children under the age of one have been reported, with a registered disease rate of 928.4 per 100,000 inhabitants. Children aged 1-4 years are registered in 211 cases and it is the second highest incidence of 227.3 per 100,000 inhabitants. According to the vaccine status, 978 or 76,1% of diseased people are unvaccinated, incompletely vaccinated or with unknown vaccine status. From those non-vaccinated persons, 217 are under 12 months of age and are not subject to vaccination, according to the Immunization Calendar. From the reported cases, 546 or 42,5% were hospitalized, and in 215 or 17.4% complications have been registered. From these, most complications - 56 or 26% were in children under the age of one, and 43 or 20% in children aged 1-4 years, suggesting that this age group is most affected and susceptible to complications.

In the course of April 26 – May 02,.2019, a total of 110 cases of measles were reported. According to the vaccine status, 84 or 76,4% of the registered cases are unvaccinated, iincompletely vaccinated or with unknown vaccine status. Most cases are over the age of 30, followed by children aged 0-4 years.

The Ministry of Health, in cooperation with the Institute for Public Health and the World Health Organization, developed leaflets with information of educational character, field vaccination of the inhabitants is carried out, as a preventive measure for further spread of the disease, the visit of unvaccinated children in the kindergartens and the hospitals is prohibited. Also, further measures is the condition for the children to get enroled in elementary school is to have confirmation letter for received vaccine.

A total of 5 people lost their lives due to a complication of the clinical picture.

It is important to point out that also medical staff employed in hospitals (15) are among the infected persons, tutors in kindergartens (10), as well as chronically ill persons who with another diagnosis were hospitalized at the Clinics in Skopje (6 persons).
results.actions_others: The Ministry of Health, in cooperation with the Institute for Public Health and the World Health Organization, developed leaflets with information of educational character, field vaccination of the inhabitants is carried out, as a preventive measure for further spread of the disease, the visit of unvaccinated children in the kindergartens and the hospitals is prohibited. Also, further measures is the condition for the children to get enroled in elementary school is to have confirmation letter for received vaccine.
results.summary: Over 1285 cases of measels and 5 dead in measels outbrake in Republic of North Macedonia

event_details.name: Fire at nuclear power plant in Rivne

results.description:
At the Rovno nuclear power plant in Ukraine caught fire. As a result of incident disconnected the third unit of the plant, reports the head of the Department of information and public relations of the Rivne NPP.
The incident occurred April 29, 2019 at 21:04. The cause of the fire was the damage to the transformer connection 7АТ. Three dozen firefighters and ten fire trucks responded to the blaze after emergency procedures were set in place, battling to bring high flames and toxic black smoke under control. The fire was liquidated at 22:00. Note that on the international scale events at nuclear facilities INES this event is classified zero level. Radiation background is normal.
The reasons of incident are established. The first and fourth power units of the plant remain in operation.
Previous emergency at the Rovno nuclear power plant occurred on April 16. The failure of the circulation pump led to the discharge reactor of the third unit.
The Rivne nuclear reactor was built in 1986, is located in the North-West of Ukraine. It operates four power units with total capacity 2 835 MW.
results.actions_others: Three dozen firefighters and ten fire trucks were operated.
results.summary: Fire at nuclear power plant in Rivne

The National society reached a total of 60,027 people with hygiene promotion messages, health education messages, and water and sanitation services to reduce the risk of cholera spread in the affected areas. The inadequate support from the various stakeholders resulted in a prolonged disease outbreak response that exhausted the limited resources available for response

event_details.name: Disease outbreaks in Kenya ( Cholera, Kalazar and Measles)

results.description:
Kenya continues to be faced with multiple disease outbreaks including Cholera, Measles and Kalazar. The epidemic continues to worsen with more people being affected in the different parts of the country as the county government, national government and other stakeholders work towards containing the ongoing disease outbreaks. 
Nine (9) out of the total 47 counties have reported active cholera since the beginning of the year 2019; Narok, Kajiado, Nairobi, Garissa, Embu, Mandera, Wajir, Mombasa and Machakos the cumulative number reported is 2,020 cholera cases (105 confirmed cases) resulting in 12 deaths (case fatality rate - CFR 0.6%). Other counties are likely to report cholera outbreak including Kirinyaga among others.  The situation is likely to worsen due to the ongoing rains following a prolonged period of delayed rainfalls in the country. 
Delayed rainfall resulted in inadequate supply of safe drinking water in various parts of the country especially in the urban areas. Sporadic outbreak is expected to continue to increase as the MAM rainfall begins in various parts of the country. It is expected that the water sources will be contaminated from the runoff and poor sanitation practices will further complicate the situation increasing the risk of cholera in the high risk areas. 
Measles Outbreak has been reported in Wajir, Tana River, Kilifi and Kwale. Wajir County had the initial outbreak on 27/09/2018 followed by Tana River, Kwale and Kilifi. Cumulatively total of 408 cases and 5 fatalities have been reported since 27/09/2018 with 4 deaths in Wajir, and 1 in Tana River giving a case fatality rate of 1.2%. Kwale outbreak is controlled. In the reporting week, there has been no new cases reported in the two Counties. Two counties ( Garissa and Kajiado)  are currently reporting  active measles outbreak.  
Two counties (Marsabit and Wajir) are currently reporting cases of Visceral Leishmaniasis (Kalazar) ; Wajir has reported 150 cases with 6 deaths (CFR 4.0%) and 27 positives. Marsabit has reported 636 cases with 7 deaths (CFR 1.1%) and 178 positives by rapid diagnostic test kits (RDT rk39). 
Anthrax has also been reported in the country (34 cases with two (2)deaths (CFR 10 %) reported in Muthara Ward, Tigania East, Meru County). The patients are reported to have consumed meat from a dead animal. No new case reported since 4th May 2019.
results.actions_others: Through the support from UNICEF and USAID - OFDA, the national society was able to mount the emergency outbreak response in the affected areas. As the MAM rains begin it is expected that the disease oubreak is going to increase in the various areas that are of high risk,. Gaps in the emergency outbreak response has make it challenging to contain the outbreak within a short time
results.summary: Disease outbreaks in Kenya ( Cholera, Kalazar and Measles)

event_details.name: El 2 y 3 de abril el desbordó el Río Parapeti dejando sin viviendas a 19 comunidades guaranís  Camir

results.description:
Los últimos días d el mes de marzo las fuertes prescipitaciones fluviales afectaron a varias familias del Municipio de Camiri, recurrente a este evento el día 3 de abril colapso el río Parapaty dejando sin hogar a varias familias del sector urbano y rural del Municipio en mención. 

En el área urbana siete de los ocho Distritos se encuentran afectados por inundación y derrumbes de viviendas y vías públicas, calles y avenidas, afectando a un número mayor a 500 familias que han quedado sin vivienda y con la perdida de muebles, equipos y vituallas (víveres, ropa, y  utensilios domésticos en general). Y en el caso de aartesanos han perdido tambaien sus herramientas y maquinaria de trabajo. 
Se han identificado que las 19 comunidades guaraní de nuestro municipio, con un total de 1.322 familias fueron afectadas, la  comunidad más lejana de la localidad de Camiri, se encuentra ubicada a 35 km. 
En el área agrícola, los terrenos  de cultivo con producción de maíz, frejol, cítricos, hortalizas (tomate, lechuga, acelga y otros), papa, se inundaron completamente de agua,  y los atajados rebalsaron. Todo esto suscito por el desborde del rio Parapeti haciéndose imperativo la construcción de defensivos en el cauce del rio para evitar ocasione daños a las comunidades cercana en el rio.
Las comunidades no solo han sufrido afectación en su áreas productivas sino también en las viviendas y edificaciones públicas, escuelas, postas de salud y centros comunitarios.
En total se han evaluado19 comunidades; Yobatitindy, Rodeo, Guazuigua, Guirarapo, Alto Camiri, Imbochi, Cañon de Segura, Urundaity, Guapoy, Itananbicua, Itakise, Pipiparirenda, Pipi Itiyuro, Pipi Santa Rita,Yuti, Puente Viejo, Piedritas, Planta de Gas y Chorety.

a pesar de que el gobierno Municiapl declaro emergencia municipal, no contó con esta nueva emergencia dejando sin vivienda a más de 500 familias en sutuación de alta vulnerabilidad
results.summary: El 2 y 3 de abril el desbordó el Río Parapeti dejando sin viviendas a 19 comunidades guaranís  Camir

actions_taken.summary:
•	NRCS HQs has been activated Emergency Operation Center since 1st April to coordinate overall response activities and coordination with all stakeholders. The EOC is closely coordinating with the Government NEOC, UN system and humanitarian agencies about the situation impacts and relief services. The Statistical situation report and bulletins have been preparing and in sharing on daily basis to all humanitarian agencies.
•	On 1st April, NRCS EOC held an emergency meeting making decision to mobilize 2 team of NDRTs in each district to support NRCS district chapters in assessment and coordination. So far, xx numbers of volunteers have been mobilized at field level. With presence of NRCS Senior management, EOC have made decisions to release NPR 100,000 along with 200 set of NFRIs to Bara District and NPR 25,000 to Parsa districts for immediate management of dry food and volunteer mobilization. 
•	NRCS Jhapa district chapter bilaterally provided cash assistance of NPR 50,000 to NRCS Bara district chapter. Likewise, NRCS Siraha and Bhaktapur district chapters supported the amount of NPR 50,000 and NPR 55,000 respectively. Additionally, NRCS Sindhuli and Sunsari district chapters supported the amount of NPR 50,000 and NPR 21,000 respectively. NRCS Chitwan district chapters handed over 500 kg beaten rice and 15 cartoons of noodle and 150 kg puffed rice to NRCS Bara district chapter.
•	NRCS district chapters and sub chapters are working closely with the concern local government, security forces and other humanitarian agencies for evacuation, assessment, immediate response and relief distribution with the mobilization of its staff and volunteers.
•	NRCS Parsa requested for blood donation and collected around 300-pint blood, fulfilling the immediate need of blood. The NRCS Central Blood Transfusion Service is in standby position to support with 200 pints' blood to affected in any cases. Three referral cases are supported with the blood from NRCS Central Blood Transfusion Service. the supply of blood as per the requirement is being managed in the districts at so far.
•	NRCS concern district chapters Bara and Parsa are regularly participating in meeting called by District Disaster Management Committee.
•	NRCS NHQs has regularly been coordinating with National Emergency Operation Centre (NEOC), located in Ministry of Home Affairs. NRCS response team consulted with chief of NEOC for deployment of Assessment Coordination Team (ACT) members and get approval for the deployment. The team will comprise member from NRCS and Nepal Police. As per the decision, the ACT team will be deployed to Bara district on 03 April 2019.

results.description: Strong windstorm caused heavy damages of in infrastructure in several areas of Bara and Parsa district on 31 March 2019. According to government record, 27 people lost their lives when they buried under rubble of houses or metal roofs that flung over the settlements. The preliminary rapid assessment report received from affected shows that more than 668 people getting injured as of today. The destruction by the storm was severe causing damage to infrastructure and properties while uprooted trees have obstructed the roads and highways as well. The search and rescue operation has been completed and still 342 injured people are undergoing medical treatment at various hospitals in Bara and Parsa district. Out of them 333 are in Parsa and 9 are getting treatment in Bara. In addition, 9 are airlifted to Kathmandu for further assistance. According to NRCS district chapters' initial report, more than 2,011 families (Approx. 12,066 people) are affected as their houses are badly damaged by the windstorm. NRCS district chapters' volunteers along with NDRT members deployed by NHQs are heavily engaged in the field to conduct assessment, analyze immediate humanitarian needs of the affected people and rendering relief services. Current situation, needs and response so far is mentioned below however initial rapid assessment is still continued in the affected areas, NRCS will keep update the information and prepare information bulletin in coming days. According to National Emergency Operation Center (NEOC), affected people are receiving supports like foods and emergency shelter from local governments, Nepal Red Cross Society, local hotels, Federation of Nepal Chamber of Commerce and Industries (FNCCI), Youth Clubs and other organizations.
results.actions_others:
•	Province 2 Government had an emergency cabinet meeting which have decided to provide NPR 300,000 to each family of deceased and free treatment to the injured. 
•	District Administration Office formed a joint assessment team with the presence of representative of local government of respective area, Nepal Police and Nepal Red Cross Society for assessment identifying the immediate need which will assist government and humanitarian agencies for further response.
•	The Ministry of Home Affairs also dispatched three trucks containing 468 units of tent and tarpaulin and 4,138 units of clothes from Kathmandu. Other relief materials are on their way to the disaster site, according to the ministry.
•	Food and other immediate relief materials have been arranged at the local level.
•	High level team visited the affected areas, observed the situation and instructed to local and national level authorities to expedite response operations. The team consists of Prime Minister, Home Minister and Health Minister
results.summary: 27 died due to Strong Windstorm No-2

event_details.name: Más de 32,000 personas afectadas por Inundación en la Región de Ucayali

results.description:
Desde el día 03 de Febrero del 2019, en toda la Región Ucayali acaecieron lluvias intensas, sobre todo han sido más constantes en la selva alta, jurisdicción de la Provincia de Atalaya y Padre Abad, hasta la cordillera de las regiones limítrofes de Huánuco, Pasco, Junín y Cusco, desencadenando el crecimiento de los caudales de los ríos y quebradas afluentes al río Ucayali, Aguaytia, San Alejandro, Neshuya, Pachitea.
Asimismo, mediante el Boletín Especial N° 09 del Servicio de Hidrografía y Navegación de la Amazonia – SEHINAV órgano técnico desconcentrado de la Dirección Nacional de Hidrografía y Navegación de la Marina de Guerra del Perú; entidad Técnico Científica según la Resolución Ministerial N° 173-2015-PCM; informo que el 05 de Febrero del 2019 el RIO UCAYALI alcanzo a un nivel de 147.17 metros de altura geoidal en Pucallpa (ALERTA ROJA).
Por tanto, dicha entidad Técnico Científica indica que teniendo en cuenta estos niveles, y de acuerdo a la data histórica que posee este Servicio Hidrográfico, se recomienda tomar precauciones de seguridad.
ACCIONES: 
28 Marzo 2019 se realizo la entrega de - Bienes de Ayuda Humanitaria para 250 familias afectadas a la Municipalidad Distrital de Yarinacocha, consistente en Abrigo, utensilios de cocina y herramientas, según cuadro detallado actualizado a la fecha de hoy; cabe manifestar que dicho acto se realizó en el almacén del GOREU donde estuvieron presentes el Gobernador Regional Señor Francisco Pezo Torres, Alcaldesa de Yarinacocha Sra. Jerly Díaz Chota, asimismo la Directora del INDECI UCAYALI Sra. Judith Ramos Campos, como ente asesor en todo momento.
- Reunión de coordinaciones sobre la Declaratoria de Estado de Emergencia con el Gobernador Regional, INDECI UCAYALI, Director Regional de Salud, Jefe de la Oficina de Defensa Nacional y GRD del GOREU.
- Difusión en los diferentes medios sobre la Declaratoria de Estado de Emergencia.
- Monitoreo y actualización permanente en el SINPAD a los Gobiernos Locales, Sectores sobre daños y peligros que pudieran suscitar en sus jurisdicciones sobre las constantes lluvias.
- Seguimiento a la solicitud de requerimiento ante la Declaratoria de Estado de Emergencia
27 Marzo 2019 - Elaboración de documentos para la entrega de los BAH a los Gobiernos Locales según requerimientos.
- Asesoramiento y asistencia técnica permanente por parte del INDECI UCAYALI sobre las acciones a tomarse en cuenta frente a la DD.EE.
- Participación mediante vídeo conferencia con el MEF sobre el PPR 068 con los funcionarios de las oficinas de Planificación y Presupuesto de la sede central del GOREU y del COER.
- Monitoreo y actualización permanente en el SINPAD a los Gobiernos Locales, Sectores sobre daños y peligros que pudieran suscitar en sus jurisdicciones sobre las constantes lluvias.
26 Marzo 2019 - Elaboración de documentos para la entrega de los BAH a los Gobiernos Locales según requerimientos.
- Monitoreo y actualización permanente en el SINPAD a los Gobiernos Locales, Sectores sobre daños y peligros que pudieran suscitar en sus jurisdicciones sobre las constantes lluvias.
- Reportes de emergencias, cuadros climáticos, niveles de ríos, boletín fluvial atmosférico y boletín informativo.
25 Marzo 2019 - Seguimiento a la solicitud ante el INDECI de la Declaratoria de Estado de emergencia.
- Monitoreo y actualización permanente en el SINPAD a los Gobiernos Locales, Sectores sobre daños y peligros que pudieran suscitar en sus jurisdicciones sobre las constantes lluvias.
- Reportes de emergencias, cuadros climáticos, niveles de ríos, boletín fluvial atmosférico y boletín informativo. (se hace todos los días).
18 Marzo 2019 - Personal de las Oficina de Defensa Civil y/o Gestión de Riesgos de Desastres de los Gobierno Locales continúan registrando la información en el SINPAD V 2.0 de acuerdo a los formularios establecidos en el EDAN PERU; y a la fecha ya se encuentran en color amarillo los registros SINPAD relacionadas con las inundaciones en la Región Ucayali.
- Permanentemente se viene realizando las coordinaciones con el personal del COEN.
- La Dirección Regional de Agricultura Ucayali y la Municipalidad Distrital de Curimana se encuentra en el campo empadronando a los propietarios de las parcelas a fin de validar los daños e ingresar dicha información el SINPAD.
- La Municipalidad Provincial de Coronel Portillo está preparando el despliegue de alimentos varios para entregar en las comunidades y caseríos afectados por inundaciones.
ACCIONES DE LA SOCIEDAD NACIONAL a Través de la Filial Provincial de Coronel Portillo: Esta realizando acciones en conjunto con el Instituto Nacional de Defensa Civil, evacuando a los afectados y delimitando zonas seguras para la población; así como monitorear el desenvolvimiento de la inundación.
results.actions_others: El gobierno a través de los municipios están realizando acciones de alivio con distribución de materiales para alojamientos temporales, artículos de protección personal y alimentación.

event_details.name: Predicted Cyclone JOANINHA to affect Rodrigues Island in Mauritius

results.description: Cyclone Bulletin for Rodrigues issued at 08h30 on Monday 25 March 2019. At 08 00 hours, the tropical cyclone Joaninha was centred at about 240 km to the north-north-west of Rodrigues, that is in latitude 17.7 degrees south and longitude 62.3 degrees east. It is now moving slowly towards the south-south-east. Gusts near the centre are of the order of 200 km/h. The cyclone has recurved towards the south-east and is dangerously approaching Rodrigues while continuing to intensify. Cyclonic conditions may be felt over the Island in the next few hours. Tropical cyclone Joaninha represents a direct threat to the island. A cyclone warning Class III is in force in Rodrigues.

results.description:
An earthquake of 5.8 magnitude shook the Island of Lombok, West Nusa Tenggara at 1500 hours (local time) with the depth of 19 km and followed by another earthquake of 5.2 magnitude at 1507hours (local time) with the depth of 10 km, with the epicenter close to East Lombok.

The Earthquake was felt in West Lombok, North Lombok, East Lombok, Central Lombok and Mataram. No tsunami alert issued by the authorities. People in Lombok panicked and evacuated to higher ground nearby.

Situation update from PMI District Branches:
• North Lombok:
Situation is under control and returning back to normal. Two people were reported with injuries and shifted to Bayan Health Centre in North Lombok by PMI Ambulance. As a result of landslide near Tiu Kelep waterfall, a bus carrying tourists stranded in the mudslide. Evacuation and identification process are underway.

• East Lombok:
PMI Community Based Action Team and Volunteers are conducting assessments in the area of Belanting. Two people reported moderately injured in Belanting village, Sambelia Sub-district. Based from initial observation, many building and infrastructure damaged by the earthquake. 

• Central Lombok:
Situation is under control and is returning back to normal. The community panicked and evacuated the buildings and gathered in Praya Public Hospital.

PMI Nusa Tenggara Barat Provincial Branch has mobilized volunteer for the rapid assessment of earthquake affected area. PMI National Headquarters along with Badan National Penanggulangan Bencana (National Disaster Management Agency) is monitoring the situation and will coordinate the response as required.
results.summary: 5.8 Magnitude Earthquake in Lombok, Indonesia

The clashes erupted when the Ukrainian president was giving a speech as part of his presidential campaign for the March 31 election.

Blood donations efforts equally mobilized for this evening and tomorrow morning at General Hospital, Marina, Lagos

event_details.name: Nigeria: 7 dead, 36 Persons with breathing difficulties in Lagos Building Collapse

results.description:
A three (3) storey building located at Massey Street by Apatira Street Junction, Ita-Faji, Lagos State, Nigeria collapsed today, 13th March, 2019 at about 9:15 a.m
Ground floor is used as:  Shops
1ST Floor:  Residential
2ND floor:  School- Private Primary School meant for the children of shop owners and other busy parents in the market environs.
3RD floor:  Mixed use

Residents in the building could not ascertain the total number in the building nor the number of pupils in the school as Nigerian Red Cross volunteers could not lay hands on the school Headmaster. However, passers-by affirmed that, residents and the school pupils would be more than 100 persons.

Seven (7) persons have been confirmed dead with 36 persons having serious breathing difficulties and, all these 36 persons have been rescued and taken to Massey Children Hospital and General Hospital Marina, Lagos.
results.actions_others:
Many relevant agencies are on ground including Julius Berger Germany Construction Company that brought in their excavator to assist in professional excavation while Red Cross personnel and other Agencies evacuate.
Others include, NEMA, LASEMA, POLICE, Nigerian Army, Lagos Neighborhood and Safety Corps (LNSC) Nigerian Civil Refence and Security Corps.
results.summary: 7 dead, 36 Persons with breathing difficulties in Lagos Building Collapse, Nigeria

event_details.name: Uganda: Suspect Plague kills one person in Zombo district

results.description:
One female adult is currently isolated at Warr HCIII of Zombo district, presented with bloody cough and difficulty in breathing. Clinicians are suspecting pneumonic plague, following a positive RDT. She is of DR Congo origin, with a history of family deaths with similar symptoms. Laboratory samples were collected and transported to the Plague Laboratory for further investigations. 
This case was first notified on Friday 1st March 2019  when an adult patient brought by relatives from the Democratic Republic of Congo for treatment at the facility later passed-on. The report indicated that the deceased had been living in DRC and had lost a 4 year old child in Atungulei village in Mahagi District, Ituri Province in the neighbouring DRC. Her Ugandan relatives had traveled there for burial. On reaching the DRC the relatives found that the deceased was also sick, and brought her back to Uganda for treatment at Warr HCIII. Unfortunately she died on arrival. The health workers made a provisional diagnosis of pneumonia. On Monday 4th March 2019 a relative of the deceased woman was admitted at Warr HCIII with history of fever, cough with bloody sputum and difficulty in breathing. Malaria RDT carried out was positive and she was put on ACTs. The Plague Team in Arua Uganda Viral Research Institute (UVRI) was called in to review the patient, and collect appropriate samples. They carried out Plague RDT using sputum sample. Preliminary test results indicated a plus three positive result. Additional samples were collected and transported to the Plague Laboratory for further investigation (culture). The patient was put on antibiotic therapy and is steadily improving. 
As of the 10th March, 2019 there are two probable cases reported in Zombo District with one death (CFR of 50%). The two cases (both female) are epidemiologically-linked with a suspected outbreak in Atungulei village, Mahagi District, Ituri Province in the DRC, where a cluster of death has been reported.
results.actions_others: A treatment centre has been established at Warr HCIII where the suspect case is currently being managed. The WHO STOP team and the Field Epidemiology Training Program (FETP) have joined the district team to support with outbreak investigation.  Infectious Disease Institute (IDI) has provided some IPC. The office of the Resident District Commissioner (RDC) has offered radio airtime which is airing plague awareness information on Radio Paidha Fm.
results.summary: Suspect Plague kills one person in Zombo district, Uganda

results.description:
Several hundred people have marched across the Ukrainian capital calling for the impeachment of the country's president. Today's president of Ukraine, who is seeking re-election in a March 31 vote, has come under fire over a journalistic investigation that implicated one of his senior associates.
President’s rival in the race, has jumped at the allegations to push for president's impeachment. Three Ukrainian lawmakers on February 28 announced that they've decided to quit President's political group, because of the investigative report. Also, on Wednesday, the country was also rocked by the Constitutional Court’s decision to annul a legal article requiring officials to prove that their assets have legitimate origins. The court ruled that the article violated the presumption-of-innocence principle. Another candidate of president, harshly criticized the Constitutional Court’s decision. The election comes amid persistent economic challenges in the country and an ongoing war in eastern of Ukraine.
The political tension brought about by street protests, and the instrument of pressure that they create, gradually increasing. Another outbreak of unrest would be a severe setback for the country, which for a long time has been trying to find a way out of crisis mode.
results.summary: Civil unrest in Ukraine

actions_taken.summary: Monitoring the situation

sources.spec: Ministry of Health of Ukraine; Center for Public Health

event_details.name: Ukraine: 23 000 cases measles outbreak year to date

results.description:
Since the beginning of 2017, a measles outbreak continues in Ukraine. During this time, almost 70,000 people in different regions of Ukraine have measles. Among them are both children and adults. According to official data, 26 people died because of the disease. Given that the authorities often hide real data, the number of people who die from measles can be much higher. In January 2019, more than 15,000 measles cases were recorded, most of them children. Meanwhile, the Ministry of Health does not intend to introduce an epidemic regime. 
From January 2018 to January 2019, most measles victims were recorded  in L’viv (total 14,524 people: 4,286 adults and 10,238 children), Zakarpattya (total 5,494 people: 1,225 adults and 4,269 children), Ivano-Frankivsk region (only 6,553 people: 1,754 adults and 4,799 children), Odesa (totaling 3,229 people: 1,585 adults and 1,644 children), Ternopil (only 4,537 people: 1,622 adults and 2,915 children), Vinnitsa (only 4,805 people: 18,800 adults and 3,005 children), Rivne (only 4,339 people: 1,379 adults and 2,960 children), Chernivtsi (only 4,344 people: 1,464 adults and 2,880 children), Khmelnitsky (total 2,474 people: 1.217 adults and 1,257 children) and Kyiv region (only 6,935 people: 3,888 adults and 3,047 children).  
The main reason for the high incidence of the disease is the population’s tendency to refuse vaccination. From 27 December 2018 to 15 February 2019, new 21,355 cases of measles were recorded.
results.actions_others:
The government is vaccinating children who for various reasons missed the vaccination. 
Now, children can get immunized against measles in the hospital as well as at school. The main condition is permission from parents.
results.summary: 21 000 cases measles outbreak in Ukraine year to date

results.description: At 13 10 hrs, intense Tropical Cyclone GELENA was centered at about 460 km to the north west of Rodrigues, that is, in latitude 18.2 degrees south and longitude 59.2 degrees east. It is moving at an accelerate speed of 22km/hr. On this trajectory, GELENA is dangerously approaching Rodrigues and constitute a direct threat to Rodrigues Island. Active cloud bands associated with the system will start to cross Rodrigues island causing a marked deterioration of the weather as from tonight and cyclonic conditions may prevail of the island. A cyclone warning Class II remains in force in Mauritius and a cyclone warning class III is in force in Rodrigues.
results.actions_others: Government: National Emergency Operations Command (NEOC) and Rodrigues Emergency Operations Command (REOC) activated to Level 2 and 3 closely monitoring the situation.
results.summary: Intense Tropical Cyclone – GELENA

event_details.name: Peru: Heavy Rains in the Arequipa Region

results.description:
El 06 de febrero de 2019 a las 17:00 horas aproximadamente, a consecuencias de las intensas precipitaciones en la zona, se produjo la activación de la quebrada Onda, afectando viviendas en el distrito de Quequeña, provincia de Arequipa. Código SINPAD V.2 N° 98025.
El 07 de febrero de 2019, a las 17:30 horas, se registraron precipitaciones pluviales intensas, como consecuencia se produjo un huaico, que afecto a la vida y salud de las personas, viviendas y vías de comunicación en el distrito Aplao, provincia de Castilla. Código SINPAD V.2 N° 98085.
El 07 de febrero de 2019, a las 16:00 horas aproximadamente, se registraron precipitaciones pluviales intensas, como consecuencia se produjo un huaico, que obstruyo la entrada de un pique minero, que la afecto a la vida y salud de las personas en el distrito de Rio Grande, provincia de Condesuyos. Código SINPAD V.2 N° 98073. El Centro de Operaciones de Emergencia del Ministerio de Defensa, en su Reporte Complementario N° 026, del 08.02.2019 informó, que: Personal del Ejercito del Perú, destacados en el Batallón de Infantería Motorizado N° 13, de la Región Arequipa, continua brindando el apoyo en remoción de escombros de las viviendas afectadas y calles del distrito de Aplao. El viernes 8 de Febrero el Centro de Operaciones de Emergencia Regional de Arequipa, informó que: Se instaló un albergue temporal en el complejo multideportivo del distrito de Aplao, donde fueron evacuadas doce familias; El Gobierno Regional de Arequipa realizo la entrega de bienes de ayuda humanitaria en el distrito de Aplao; Se encuentran trabajando en la zona afectada maquinaria pesada del Gobierno Regional de Arequipa (cuatro volquetes y dos volquetes) y de la Municipalidad Provincial de Castilla (dos cargadores frontales); El Jefe de la Oficina de Gestión de Riesgo de Desastres de la Municipalidad Provincial de Castilla continúa con la Evaluación de Daños y Análisis de Necesidades.
LA CRUZ ROJA PERUANA a través de los voluntarios de la Filial de Arequipa: están movilizando un Equipo de Respuesta conformado por 5 voluntarios y una unidad vehicular llevando suministros de emergencia y abrigo para 30 familias, así mismo iniciarían Evaluaciones Rápidas  y atención con Apoyo Psicosocial.
results.summary: 3705 PERSONAS AFECTADAS POR LLUVIAS INTENSAS EN EL DEPARTAMENTO DE AREQUIPA - PERÚ

Support to BDRCS to carry out above actions taken by BDRCS

contacts.title: Director, Disaster Response and International Relation & Communication Department

results.description:
There are an estimated 908000 displaced peoples from Myanmar in Cox’s Bazar, according to the latest Needs and Population Monitoring (NPM) round 12 exercise. The displaced communities from Myanmar continue to face compounding vulnerabilities including health. In recent weeks there has been increase number of Varicella cases reported in the camps for displaced people from Myanmar. In response to the outbreak of suspected Varicella in the camps, BDRCS along with health sector partners led by the Ministry of Health have stepped up surveillance and initiated measures to curtail further spread of the disease and prevent any complications.
The number of the suspected Varicella cases has started to rise during end December 2018 and kept rising during January 2019. The reasons behind this may be due to awareness about self-quarantining of the cases in the household or absence of complication of the cases. The predictive modelling for Varicella outbreak suggests the number of cases will rise in coming weeks.
results.actions_others: Ministry of Health, Director General of Health Services (DGHS) and WHO
results.summary: Suspected Varicella Outbreak

actions_taken.summary: La Cruz Roja Guatemalteca ha mantenido el monitoreo de la afectación del sismo a nivel nacional y sus 21 Delegaciones se encuentran registrando la información de los posibles impactos. Se han realizado evacuaciones de población en edificios y zonas residenciales. En Quetzaltenango se realizó la evaluación del deslizamiento en una mina, sin daños qué reportar. La CRG Delegación El Palmar realizó la verificación de daños en la ruta que conduce de Retalhuleu a Quetzaltenango, por los desprendimientos de rocas que afectan el tránsito. La CRG Delegación San Marcos realizar recorridos para verificar daños a personas y viviendas. El Centro de Operaciones de Emergencia de CRG se mantiene activo, dando monitoreo a todos los incidentes registrados como consecuencia de este sismo, así como los requerimientos de atención a la población.

sources.spec: Dirección de Gestión de Riesgos a Desastres

results.description: Un sismo ocurrió a las 10:14 horas del 1 de febrero de 2019, con magnitud de 6.8 en la escala de Richter.  El epicentro se ubica en la zona fronteriza con México, en las cercanías del litoral Pacífico y es asociado a la zona de subducción.  Los reportes preliminares indican deslizamientos y daños en algunas edificaciones coloniales y viviendas débiles. El sismo fue sensible en la mayor parte del territorio nacional. Una réplica de mejor intensidad fue sensible en la misma región. Los departamentos con mayor afectación son Quetzaltenango, San Marcos, Sololá y Chimaltenango. No se registran datos de afectación a personas. No se descarta la generación de más réplicas en las próximas horas.
results.actions_others: Las autoridades del Insivumeh ha presentado el boletín del sismo. La Conred registra los daños a nivel municipal, departamental y nacional. El Ministerio de Educación ha concedido la autorización para que los Directores Departamentales  hagan uso de su criterio para suspender clases a todo nivel. El Ministerio de Salud se encuentra en alerta institucional. El Ministerio de Comunicaciones, Infraestructura y Vivienda realiza la limpieza de los deslizamientos que obstruyen las carreteras.
results.summary: Sismo de 6.8 en Guatemala
